resources.string: The True Heir to the throne has come… he has returned!
You-you… ah yes, come forth, yes, please, come hither...
The True Heir to the throne has come… he has returned!
You!
Ah yes, come forth!
Yes, please, come hither...
It's a happy day when the woman you've loved several lifetimes says yes to being yours.
The sky may fall down, but as for me, I am the happiest man on Aeternum - nay, in the world!
<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Welcome to Prydwen, traveler! I do hope you're the honorable sort. Security is critical right now. But, you seem friendly enough. Carry on!

<g id="male_spreadarms001" />Welcome to Prydwen, traveler! <g id="male_nodunderstand" />The greatest kingdom on Aeternum… well, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />to be precise, it's a regency, currently, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />but that will change!

<g id="male_realize" />Have you come from the beach, then? We've had disturbing reports. <g id="male_secretiveshort" />Not just the self-proclaimed king squatting down there… <g id="male_nodunderstand" />but something even worse.
"You mean the Corrupted?"

So it's true, then? <g id="male_darnit" priority="high" />God's ears! Why must every day bring such foul tidings! <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Derelict knights, greedy farmers… it never ends. <g id="female_shakeheadNo" />And now the Corrupted, too.
<g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />The worst part is that it's all happening on the eve of the most fortuitous occasion Prydwen's known in four hundred years!
Welcome to Prydwen
Check in at the Regent's Rise Inn, and keep an eye out for the pirate captain from the beach, Grace O'Malley.
"What's the occasion?"
<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> Why nothing less thrilling than the return of the 'True Heir'! Ser Gawain is coming home after centuries to finally claim the throne of High King Artorius!

<g id="female_explains" />Of course, however, Knight-Regent Jin Jae is officially still in charge of our fair town. <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />As a matter of fact, she'll want to hear your account from the beach.
"So I report to the Regent?"

<g id="male_waghand02" />Don't feel you have to rush, of course! <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Welcoming those who've just washed ashore is a Prydwen tradition. <g id="male_gesturebackthere" />Free room and board at the Regent's Rise Inn.
<g id="male_think" />I just sent another newcomer from the beach that way… shady sort. Couldn't take her word for anything, as you might imagine.
"You mean Grace O'Malley?"

<g id="male_chuckle" />Hmmph! <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Sounds like her. A sailor's tongue, alright! <g id="male_secretiveshort" />Probably someone you shouldn't consort with! Appearances, you know.

So again, <g id="male_complimentplayer" />welcome to Prydwen! Check in at the inn, see the Regent when you can, and <g id="female_nodyes" />join us in celebration when the True Heir returns. Jolly good!

<g id="female_lookaroundShifty" priority="high" />It's a long day at this post with no relief. If someone doesn't show up soon, I'm afraid <g id="female_nodyes" />I'll have to go off into the bushes for a minute or two.
<g id="grace_cajole" priority="high"/>Now there's a familiar face! About time you caught up.
<g id="grace_spreadarms" />Here we find ourselves in a little village pulled straight from the Middle Ages. <g id="grace_secret" />Is it me, or does nothing on this island make any sense at all?
"I have a lot of questions."
<g id="grace_yes" />No doubt, for a place where everyone gets eternal life, you'd think it'd be more… calm, dull even. <g id="grace_shrugDontknow" />Not saying I'd like that, mind you.
<g id="grace_welcome" />One thing that is the same though is cold, hard coin. You have it or you don't, <g id="grace_yes" />makes all the difference.
Check in at the Regent's Rise Inn
Check in at the Regent's Rise Inn
<g id="grace_wherearewe" />Strange island, strange little town, strange people. Out of everyone I've met, you're the only one I feel I can trust.
<g id="grace_yes" />We're both a little light in the pocket, <g id="grace_giveitem" priority="high"/>but I did sell that loot we collected, so there's your share.
<g id="grace_bowhead" priority="high"/>Never let it be said Grace O'Malley doesn't pay her debts.
Friends with Coin
Grace O'Malley has given you the coin she owes you. Look for bargains at the Trading Post and store the excess at the Storage Shed.
"So what do we do now?"

<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />Well, you got that coin I just gave you so I'd suggest you get to spending it. <g id="grace_gestureL" />Buy yourself a new blade, some new boots, whatever suits your fancy.
"Is there a shop here?"
<g id="grace_yes" />Ah yeah, there's a trading post out there, <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />livelier market than I would've expected.
<g id="grace_gesturebothhands" />You should check out the Trading Post and the Storage, and then what do you say? Let's meet in the tavern. <g id="grace_salutefingers" />Alright see you there!
<g id="grace_secret" />You're in a new town, and you have some coin now - I'd get to spending it or stashing it myself.
<g id="female_spreadarms" />Here comes a lovely walk and a dangerous smile. Am I finally to meet a muse sent by the Ancients themselves to inspire me?
"If so, no one told me."
<g id="female_chuckle" />Ha! Then I won't ask you to buy me a tankard,<g id="female_thinking" /> but since you seem a playful one, "o muse," what do you think would inspire a song in me?

<g id="female_chuckle" />Ha! Then I won't ask you to buy me a tankard, but <g id="male_nodunderstand" />I will dedicate my next song to you. You'll have to come back to hear it. Until then, happy travels!
"Sleeping under the stars with me."
Now who's fishing lines? You’ve got me cherry to the collar. Let's talk anon, my love, and I'll share my sheets. Of music, and maybe more, if you're lucky.
"Life as a bard on Aeternum?"
There’s a song best sung after some ale. I've as many memories trodding boards soaked in wine, as I do of ale-sodden bores trodding on me. But I'll try.
"A blackbird pie?"
Ha! A muse and a joker, are you? Better to fool than be fooled, is it? Comedy's not my suit, but you've caught me grinning, so I'll try. Come back and see!
"Lay, they lay, under the stars. For the wine and clouds mixed, she fell on her- Ask, ask, ask of the moon." What, that's plenty romantic!
"A bard on Aeternum is to laugh- and cry for hundreds of years. To dance and fling your heart away, through glory and in tears." Well, it's a start.
This one's about a man who loved his staff too much. Ahem. "Fire staff, better half, hotter than no other, meaner than my mother, there can be no other, Fire Staff!"
<g id="grace_gesturebothhands" />Look at you! Here just a few hours and you're already the most popular person in town. You had a caller while you were out.

<g id="grace_chuckle" />Lively little ditty there, kinda oversells the place, don't you think? <g id="grace_headshakeno" />I sure won't be calling this place home. <g id="grace_shrugdontcare" />But hey, aren't you popular?

<g id="grace_gestureLefthand" />Messenger from the Knight-Regent herself was looking for you. <g id="grace_yes" />Getting fancy, aren't we? <g id="grace_pointr" />She's keen to have a word with you up at the keep.
Talk to Grace O'Malley
Visit the Prydwen Trading Post
Check out the local Storage Shed
Meet Grace O'Malley in the tavern
Watch the Bard's performance
Talk to the bard in the tavern
<g id="grace_shifty" priority="high" />Word around town says the Knight-Regent's just a puppet, and some Minister Lochnir's actually running things. And then this 'True Heir' business…
<g id="grace_secret" priority="high" />You'd think that's what drew the crowds, but barkeep says it's really just people fleeing from trouble at the outlying farms.
The Knight-Regent
Grace O'Malley says a messenger came from the Knight-Regent who's requested you come see her at the keep.
"What kind of trouble?"
<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />Sounds like some kinda plague - people turning on their friends and neighbors <g id="grace_headshakeno" />with cold murder in their eyes.
<g id="grace_liftbothhands" />Unlike those red-eyed bastards on the beach, these folks aren't possessed. <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />Seems like they don't have any souls at all.
"Aelstrom said it’s even worse.”
<g id="grace_doubt" />I didn't trust all the shite coming out of that oaf's mouth, but maybe there was some truth to it.

<g id="grace_cajole" priority="high"/>I'll be more interested to hear what the Knight-Regent has to say! Particularly if there's mention of coin! <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />I'm right here if you need me.
<g id="grace_shifty" priority="high"//>Apparently that Knight, Ser Payne, he's about five hundred years old. I guess that explains why he's such an uptight bastard.
Meet with Knight-Regent Jin Jae at the Prydwen Keep
<g id="grace_shifty" />I heard this "True Heir" is traveling here by a ship along the coast.
<g id="grace_secret" />Thinking he might not be needing it any more. Could be that ship's available for a new captain…
The farmers, the knights, the miners… no word in days! We need to know what's going on out there, Lochnir.
The people are simply distracted… word has spread of the True Heir's return.
As acting regent, I'm sure this is unsettling for you, but you can set aside your concerns…
When the new king is ready to assume his duties, I will gladly stand down, but not before.
Of course. Now, I have preparations to attend to.
The farmers, the knights, the miners… no word in days!
We need to know what's going on out there, Lochnir.
The people are simply distracted…
word has spread of the True Heir's return.
As acting regent, you have served Prydwen faithfully, and I'm sure this is unsettling for you…
but you can set aside your concerns…
When the new king is ready to assume his duties, I will gladly stand down.
But not before.
Of course.
Now, I have preparations to attend to.
<g id="female_bowDeep" priority="high"/>Normally, I would extend every courtesy to a new visitor to Prydwen, but there are serious matters that require my attention.

<g id="male_bowShallow" priority="high"/>Ah, you must be the one from the beach. <g id="female_clasphandsrequest" />Ser Payne believes you to be honorable, and I trust his judgment, but I like to hear reports first-hand.

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />We saw signs of Corruption by the shore, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />but we believed it was isolated and that no one had actually become Corrupted. <g id="male_spreadarms001" />Did you see them yourself?
"Yes. I saw dozens of Corrupted."
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />That is… not what I wanted to hear, but I see the sincerity in your eyes.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />You should know that we normally go to great lengths to make newcomers feel welcome in Prydwen. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I am sorry if I seem impatient just now.
Talk to Knight Payne

<g id="female_worry" priority="high" />With all the excitement for the return of the True Heir, I believe we are ignoring signs of grave threats to Prydwen, <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />and news of Corrupted adds to the list.
<g id="male_realize" />However, the greater concern right now is the rash of disappearances, <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />sworn knights who've failed to report in over the last several weeks.
Foreman's Fate
Knight-Regent Jin Jae, knight in charge of Monarch's Bluffs, has asked you to help Allya Musa at Cynefin Mines.
"You've sent search parties?"

<g id="female_nodyes" />Minister Lochnir has sent scouts, but they've not returned as of yet, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />and now I fear they are missing as well. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Still, he counsels patience!
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />Lochnir believes the return of the royal bloodline will solve all problems. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I feel strongly that we cannot afford to wait for Gawain.
"Is there anything I can do?"
<g id="male_apologizeSmall" />Oh, I'm sorry. This is poor form on my part, dropping all my troubles on your boots. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I would not impose on someone who just arrived.

<g id="female_thinking" />Still, with the remaining knights spread thin, you're probably able to get me answers faster than they can. Hm... <g id="male_shrugbrief" />the mine is not so far away either.
"What's going on at the mine?"

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />That's just it. We don't know. The foreman there - Allya Musa - is a personal friend, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />and she usually visits once a week, <g id="male_shrugBrief" />but it's been a month.

<g id="male_compliment" />If you're truly willing, I would ask you to check on Foreman Musa and report back… oh, <g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />and please inform Minister Lochnir of your mission, just so he's aware.
<g id="female_worry" priority="high" />Foreman Musa usually sends regular status reports. I hope all is well, but we need to be certain.
<g id="female_clasphandsrequest" />If there is indeed trouble at the mines, do what you can to help them. Let me know what comes of it.
<g id="male_bowShallow" priority="high" />Well, you seem to be getting along ! I do hope you had time to meet with the Knight-Regent. She was rather anxious to hear your account.
<g id="male_bowShallow" priority="high"/>Excellent to see you again! I hope you've been steering clear of that pirate captain who arrived just before you. A bad influence, in my estimation.
<g id="male_think" />Yes, I do hope all these reports regarding the Lost turn out to be exaggerated.
<g id="male_shakehead" /> It simply wouldn't do to have the True Heir return to find we've allowed things to get so dire.

<g id="guard_gestureleftM" />Prydwen is a town unlike any other in Aeternum. Here, we honor the traditions from the reign of the High King. <g id="guard_nod" />I take personal interest in ensuring that.

<g id="guard_laughmed" />Ah yes, the newcomer invited to an audience with the Knight-Regent. Imagine, <g id="guard_shrugbrief" />if you had arrived a few days later, you might've been welcomed by a king!
<g id="guard_nod" />Yes, Gawain's return will restore Prydwen's glory. <g id="guard_gestureleftM" />The Knight-Regent has performed well with my counsel, but she sometimes... exceeds her mandate.
"Isn't she still in charge?"

<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />For now. But she would do well not to concern herself with matters our new king can better adjudicate. <g id="guard_headtilthmm" />Tell me, has she enlisted you in one of her endeavors?
"Actually, I volunteered."
<g id="guard_gestureleftM" />Well, aren't we proving our value quickly? <g id="guard_nod" />I'm sure the king will also be grateful for those who willingly submit to his guidance.

<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />It's not my place to countermand the Knight-Regent's orders, <g id="guard_headshakeno" />but I would hate to see a prospective resident waste their time. <g id="guard_gestureleftM" />The tavern is open, you know.
<g id="guard_nod" />I do hope you appreciate your good fortune. The future is very bright. <g id="guard_gestureleftM" />When the True Heir assumes the throne, we will restore Prydwen's former glory.
Stop this…! I’m your friend! After all the years in that hole together… don’t make me do this!
Stay back… I won't tell you again!
Forgive me.
Stop this…! I’m your friend!
[Grunting]
After all the years in that hole together… don’t make me do this!
Stay back…
I won't tell you again!
Aaaargh!
Forgive me.
<g id="male_handshipsdisapprove" />Believe me when I say, you don’t want to go into the mine. Everyone's fallen Lost, and still no word from Prydwen.
<g id="male_waghand02" />Whoah, you. If you thought you were going to the mines, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />think again.
<g id="male_handheart" />If you have loved ones in there, I don't know what to tell you. Almost everyone's fallen Lost, and no support from Prydwen in sight.
“I came from the Knight-Regent."
<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />Oh, so NOW she sends someone? And a stranger who's not even a knight?

<g id="female_whattheheck" priority="high"/>I sent dispatches, informing the Regent of what happened and I even said: "send every knight available!" <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Doesn't look like that's what's happening.
Check if Cynefin Mine is alright by asking Foreman Allya about it.
<g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />For a while, some of the miners were holding out, fighting back with their picks against the teeth and claws of their now-Withered friends.
<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />At this point, it's probably a lost cause. <g id="male_shakehead" />I can't imagine that any of them are still standing.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />It was startling to see some of my miners escaping with their souls intact. The Knight-Regent may have sent help late, but I'm glad she sent you.
Crisis at the Mines
A worried Allya Musa wants you to rescue any surviving miners at Cynefin Mine.
"I can go in and search."
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You're brave, I'll give you that. But we're not talking about a handful of Withered, <g id="male_converseleft" />we're talking about the whole damn mine.
<g id="female_nodding" />Look for that stubborn Elias Derit, and anyone else who's not fallen, and then get them - and yourself - out of there quickly.
<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> You may not be a knight, but you got courage. And if that translates into some of my miners getting out of there, I sure as hell won't complain.
I-I thought I'd never get out of here… thank you!
The mine's lost! Everyone is Withered! I'm getting out of here!
Look for Elias, he was trying to fight back… I'm making a run for it!
I won’t leave here, not till every last one of us is safe. The others depend on me.
<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />Finally, a sign of hope! A brave warrior battling their way through the Withered.
<g id="female_cheerFistpump" />It's beyond a relief to see you up here. <g id="female_nodyes" />Now maybe we can find a way to reclaim the mine.
“I'm just here to get you out."
<g id="male_willcoverit" />And for that I'm mighty grateful, sure enough! <g id="male_shakehead" />But we can't go without dealing with that infernal relic that caused this disaster.
Look for Elias Derit at Hiraeth Peak
<g id="female_taptemple" /> I saw it with my own eyes - an ancient tablet unearthed from its rocky tomb. <g id="male_shakehead" />I had a bad feeling about it from the start. An ill omen to be sure!
A Most Mysterious Tablet
Elias Derit believes a strange magical tablet is causing the trouble at the mines. Destroy the tablet and the Lost Pirates who guard it.
"Did you have it removed?"

<g id="male_righthandNodeal" />Nah! I told the crew no one was to touch the damn thing… it was thrumming with some unholy energy. <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />I wanted to get the Sage Moira out here to study it.

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Of course, never got the chance... Next morning, the first of the miners fell to the curse, <g id="female_smackfist" />and then the Lost Pirates attacked - hunting for that tablet, no doubt.
"The pirates were Lost too?"

<g id="female_nodyes" />Yah, and they're guarding the tablet like it's some kind of treasure! <g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />If we don't destroy that damned thing, I fear the curse will spread beyond the mine!
"I'll destroy the tablet."
<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" />You're clearly capable, and I won't complain. I'd go with you, but I'm plumb exhausted from this ordeal, <g id="male_willcoverit" />and I'm not much of a fighter.

<g id="male_compliment" />But don't forget! Sage Moira needs to see what started this. Smash the tablet and collect the fragments, <g id="female_nodding" />and then bring them back. We'll leave together, or not at all.
<g id="male_pointBlame" />You said you'd shatter that damn tablet, and I'll be holding you to it!

<g id="g_male_spreadarms001" />You did it, then? Shattered the tablet? God's blood! I'm glad <g id="male_shrugBrief" />I didn't send you in there to your doom. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />I'd have felt bad about that.
Report the Tablet's Destruction to Elias Derit

<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />I hate to abandon the mine, but with the tablet gone, <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />maybe these pirates clear out and we can get back to work after time passes… if anyone's left, that is.
Fragments of Truth
Elias Derit wants you to take back news of Hiraeth Peak to Knight-Regent Jin Jae at Prydwen.
"You, the Foreman and few others."

<g id="male_goodnews" />Ah, Musa. She's a stubborn one, alright. I'll wager she's still waiting at the mine's entrance. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I'll go and try to convince her to come back to town.
<g id="male_compliment" />But you my friend, you must make haste back to Prydwen. Tell the Knight-Regent what happened here, <g id="male_converseright" />and give the tablet fragments to Sage Moira.
"We'll get some answers."

<g id="female_nodyes" />Aye, let's hope. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />If anyone will know what in tarnation that thing is, it'll be Sage Moira. <g id="male_secretiveshort" />Let's hope it's not related to those rumors from the southern farms.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I'll go and round up Foreman Musa and the others. <g id="female_gestureRight" />Meet me back in town when this is over and the first round at Geertie's is on me!
<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Bring the news of what happened here to Prydwen and get Sage Moira to study those fragments. <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />Don't waste time, now.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I sure hope Geertie's got a pot of turnip soup going back at the tavern. I haven't eaten in, <g id="male_shrugBrief" />oh I don't know... too long!
<g id="male_goodnews" />You return. Excellent. Minister Lochnir said I sent you on a fool's errand, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />but I can see from your expression you bring dark tidings.
<g id="female_worry" priority="high" /> What did Foreman Musa say? Tell me the miners are all right.
"A few, but most have become Lost."

<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" /> I can't tell you how disappointed I am to hear that. <g id="male_guiltyLookside" priority="high" />I have failed in my duty to protect the people of Prydwen.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />The warnings were there, and I allowed them to be ignored.
Inform Knight-Regent Jin Jae about the Lost at the mines.
<g id="male_fistpumpRight" />From this moment forward, I will take every precaution to ensure the people of Prydwen are safe, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />inside and outside these walls.
<g id="female_spreadarms" />We will start by discovering how this disaster at the mine began. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Surely someone saw something.
Source of the Plague
Knight-Regent Jin Jae asks you to bring the recovered tablet fragments to Sage Moira so she can study them for answers and to ask Minister Lochnir about the reports from the mine.
"They dug up an ancient tablet."
<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />Such relics are better left in the earth. The ruins of Aeternum hold dangerous secrets <g id="male_nodunderstand" />that are best left uncovered.
<g id="male_think" />We'll need to have Sage Moira study this tablet for answers. If it can even be recovered, I suppose.
"I have fragments of the tablet."

<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Excellent! Then please, do me one additional favor, and bring them to Sage Moira. <g id="female_explains" />She knows this island and its secrets far better than I do.

<g id="male_handheart" />But before you go, what of Foreman Musa…? <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I fear to ask after my dear friend. Is she alright? <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Did she try to send for help?
"Yes, and she sent dispatches."

<g id="female_whattheheck" priority="high" />But I received no dispatches at all. <g id="male_shakehead" />This makes no sense… unless, well… <g id="male_think" />perhaps Minister Lochnir will be able to surmise how this occurred.

<g id="male_apologizesmall" />I'm sorry to impose further, but after seeing Sage Moira, <g id="male_compliment" />could you look for the Minister in the town square? <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Tell him I require his counsel… urgently.
<g id="male_realize" />At this point, we know there is a curse out there. It's time we got some answers.
<g id="female_youknow" />History is being made in Prydwen, visitor. The return of Ser Gawain to claim the throne is an event we've awaited for centuries.
<g id="female_nodyes" />I've just seen Elias and learned of the tragedy at the mine. <g id="female_liftHandsXs" />Are you the one who recovered the fragments of this tablet they stumbled onto?
"Yes, I have them right here."

Hm. <g id="female_takeItem8s" priority="high" />Very… interesting. Elias said they unearthed this tablet, but it has signs of extensive weathering. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />Yes, it has clearly been exposed to the elements.

<g id="male_think" />I will have to study these fragments more closely. In the meantime, <g id="female_spreadarms" />you are new to Prydwen, are you not? Quite a moment to arrive. Do you know our history?
"No, not really."
<g id="male_explain" />On the precipice of Ser Gawain's return to claim the throne, you should learn the significance of this event. <g id="male_secretiveshort" />Let me tell you the full story…
[Trigger 2.5 D Cinematic] Script is here: https://confluence.collab.games.aws.dev/display/JAV/The+Empty+Throne

Now, <g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />perhaps you understand how momentous Gawain's return really is… <g id="male_nodunderstand" />and why it's so worrisome to hear this news from the mine... and from the farms.
"What's happened at the farms?"

<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Though Minister Lochnir has been keeping it quiet to avoid a panic, <g id="female_nodyes" />we've had quite a few refugees claiming their farms are overrun with Lost.

<g id="male_nodunderstand" />But Lochnir assures me it's under control. If you have further questions, ask him. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I must get to studying these fragments. Let's hope they yield answers.
<g id="female_thinking" /> There's simply no way this tablet was buried for any length of time… perhaps I can discern where it came from.
… after so many years without our true leader, it’s natural to have doubts… but I assure you, the hour draws near! The bloodline of Artorius will soon sit again upon the throne!
What we have endured here pales in comparison with what challenges Gawain has faced in his long journey home, but he has persevered for you! The people of Prydwen.
We must ask ourselves, how will we show, nay - prove to our new king that we are as devoted to him, as he is to us?!
When the hour arrives, I know he will find his subjects have remained true… and we will honor him as we once honored Artorius himself!
...and pledge our undying loyalty.
… after so many years without our true leader, it’s natural to have doubts…
But I assure you, the hour draws near!
The bloodline of Artorius will soon sit again upon the throne!
[Cheering]
What we have endured here pales in comparison with what challenges Gawain has faced in his long journey home…
but he has persevered for you!
The people of Prydwen.
We must ask ourselves, how will we show, nay - prove to our new king that we are as devoted to him, as he is to us?!
When the hour arrives, I know he will find his subjects have remained true…
and we will honor him as we once honored Artorius himself!
[Cheering]
...and pledge our undying loyalty.
<g id="guard_gestureleftM" />Ah! Our brave newcomer returns! I understand the Knight-Regent dispatched you to the mines. <g id="guard_shrugbrief" />A lot to ask of a guest, but it's her prerogative.
<g id="guard_nod" />Do tell, though - I hope the situation there wasn't as dire as it sounded.
"It was, and they sent dispatches."

<g id="guard_headtilthmm" />She said that, did she? Well yes, <g id="guard_nod" />I do recall receiving at least one dispatch, <g id="guard_headshakeno" />but her demands were absolutely out of the question.
<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />The Foreman wanted us to send all our knights to help defend the mines, but that was, <g id="guard_nod" />of course, impossible.

<g id="guard_gestureleftM" />With all the preparations for the return of the True Heir, we simply <g id="guard_shrugbrief" />can't dispatch our knights everywhere they're needed.

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Perhaps it's just as well. As Knight-Regent, it may be best if <g id="male_willcoverit" />I handle matters personally going forward.
<g id="male_complimentplayer" />The Knight-Regent seems to think very highly of you, as do I!

<g id="male_converseleft" />While you were away, Foreman Musa visited and <g id="male_shakehead" /> related the whole story from the mines.

Knight in the North
Knight-Regent Jin Jae is beginning to trust you. She's asked you to join Ser Payne Bennett in challenging the Pirates encamped at Brysedd Shore.
"Yes, I fought them myself."

<g id="male_pointsoutthere" />These pirates could only have come from the Brysedd Shore to the north. <g id="male_handsHipsConsider" priority="high" />There was a den of brigands there, and now they are apparently Lost.

<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" />Lochnir will not be pleased, but perhaps he will now deign to pay me a visit.

<g id="male_complimentplayer" />You are eager and courageous, and it is most welcome.

<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" priority="high" />My hope is that you and Ser Payne can deter the pirates from further incursions and discover what drives them. <g id="female_gestureRightM" />May fortune go with you both.
<g id="female_nodyes" />You will find Ser Payne and his squire at Brysedd Shore. I have no doubt your support will be welcome.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Minister Lochnir finally graced me with his presence. I was able to speak with him at last.
<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" priority="high"/>As much as I respect the man's legacy here in Prydwen, his explanations are not satisfactory.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />How is Ser Payne? He is one of our most trusted knights and a seasoned soldier. I hope you managed to rout the pirates together…?
<g id="female_saluteFistchest" /> Good of you to join us, my valiant friend! <g id="male_compliment" />I heard about your heroics at the mine. You definitely have the makings of a knight!
<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />For now, we are simply grateful to have your support. <g id="male_gestureHereweare" priority="high" />Not quite a full contingent here, I'm afraid.

<g id="g_male_gesturebackthere" priority="high" />There's a splendid spot nearby. Set your tent,<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> relax a bit if you like, we'll be here!

Making a camp should be simple. <g id="female_explainS" />You just need a spot and a few materials. You can collect materials from around here. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />You don't have to look too far.
<g id="female_nodRelieved" />Ah, you're back! I'm at a bit of a loss here. A few months ago, <g id="male_gestureright" />this barren beach had nothing but a smattering of pirates.

<g id="female_youknow" />You two stay here and defend our position. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I will go forth and challenge the leader of the pirates to a duel.

Ser Payne has asked you to use unusual methods to fight the filthy Lost pirates. Cut off their supplies and set their boats adrift!

<g id="male_realize" />Oh, well, yes, good point. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I suppose our options will be more limited, then.

<g id="male_compliment" />If you can destroy their rowboats and all the cargo they've dropped, <g id="female_nodyes" />that would slow them down. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I'll stay and keep an eye out for their leader.
<g id="female_smackfist" /> Strike a blow to the pirates' supply lines. <g id="female_nodyes" />That'll shake them up! Honor and duty, my friend, honor and duty!
Report back to Ser Payne Bennett
Come on, you stiff-necked fool! What possible interest would I have in spying on this pathetic little outpost you got here?
You see, that is precisely the kind of thing a spy would say… particularly when she was caught creeping around near our camp.
Tell me this, then, Ser Wisdom… what exactly would I wanting to learn? How you scratch your arse in an iron suit?
Hah! Trying to distract me with insults, eh? But it won’t work!
Took your sweet time gettin' here! I was sizing up the pirate base until this suspicious sod nabbed me… Can you tell him I'm not a spy?
Yea, yea, very funny!
Ah, well, if you know her, then I suppose that we can give her another chance…
But I’ll have my eye on you, young lady…
Better keep your eyes to yourself, unless you want em poked out.

A Pirate's Plan
Grace O'Malley knows what's summoning the Lost. Go into the Pirates' den and destroy the evil altar.
"Yes, she's on our side."

<g id="male_nodunderstand" />Very well, then. If she's to be believed, <g id="male_converseright" />the source of this plague on our lands may well be inside. You'll have to hear her account yourself.

<g id="male_compliment" />If you're willing to venture into the den on her word, then so be it. <g id="male_willcoverit" />We'll hold this position. But be wary! <g id="male_nodunderstand" />The pirates were fierce... even before becoming Lost.

<g id="grace_crossarmsInsulted" />Well now, I do hope you straightened everything out with Ser Pain-in-me-arse! <g id="grace_gestureRLow" />I tried to tell that sod, if you want to defeat these pirates, I know the way.

<g id="grace_convince2" />And they've got some loot sure enough, but they don't even seem to care about it. <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />I guess that's what happens when you lose your soul.

<g id="grace_secret" priority="high" />So here it is: there's a glowing altar in there, and the bastards are drawn to it like flies to a carcass. <g id="grace_smackfist" />Smash the damn thing, and I bet they'll all buzz off!

<g id="grace_secret" priority="high" />For someone like you, maybe. Not for me! But hey, don't forget our deal! <g id="grace_gestureRighthand" />Snatch me up some valuables in there, and we'll be that much closer to getting a ship.

<g id="grace_clenchfists1" />See there, we make a good team! <g id="grace_handheart" />I go in first, all sneaky like, and get the lay of the land. <g id="grace_smackfist" />Then you follow up with force, taking care of business.

<g id="grace_gesturer" />And Ser Pain-in-me arse let slip that the Knight-Regent wants to hire scouts. <g id="grace_handheart" />I'd say that job has my name on it, so I'll see you back in Prydwen.

n/a

Relics of the Ancients
Regent Jin Jae has asked you to work with Sage Moira to determine if there is any connection between the tablet from the mine and the altar in the pirate's den.
"Yes, we should ask Sage Moira."
<g id="female_nodyes" /> Exactly. She's been studying the fragments you brought back from the mine for a while. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Surely, she's learned something.
<g id="male_nodSympathySmall" /> If so, I would ask you to work with Moira to follow up on any leads. I, unfortunately, must attend to less pleasant matters.

<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" priority="high" />Yes, you've earned that right. I must soon deal with Minister Lochnir's disrespect head-on. <g id="male_righthandAngry" />He's avoiding me, and there are things he must answer for.
<g id="male_willcoverit" />I must handle this myself, though. <g id="male_compliment" /> You should seek out Moira straightaway. Dealing with this plague of Lost is the kingdom's highest priority.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Please. For now, let's keep this talk of Minister Lochnir between us. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />Don't even speak of it to Moira.
<g id="male_think" />If there is some connection between the tablet and the altar at the pirate's den, <g id="male_nodunderstand" />please let me know right away.

<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Ah, just the person I was hoping to see. Comparing the tablet fragments to other stonework from the region,<g id="female_youknow" /> I believe I've found where it came from.

<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> I know you've just returned from the north… if it's true that the pirates are <g id="male_secretiveshort" />indeed all Lost, did you see anything similar to the tablet?

<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" />Now you know why most on Aeternum avoid ruins at all costs. I myself have only visited Khalladan once, <g id="female_nodyes" />but if we're to find answers, that's where they'll be.

<g id="male_compliment" />You're a brave soul, but don't go too deep. There are unspeakable dangers down there. <g id="male_spreadhands" />Stick to the surface, that's where our tablet came from. Go, now.

<g id="male_handheart" />I will inform the Knight-Regent of what we've discovered. <g id="female_gestureRightM" />Learn what you can from the ruins and return. I know she will be anxious to hear what you find.

Hmm... <g id="guard_shrugbrief" />the Knight-Regent should not be conducting affairs she <g id="guard_headshakeno" />can't reveal to her people, wouldn't you agree?

<g id="guard_dismissLeft" />You presume much, page. I simply wish to convey <g id="guard_nod" />any pressing matters to the True Heir when he arrives.
<g id="guard_shrugbrief" />Keep your secrets, but know this - Prydwen will be united as never before to honor the royal bloodline. <g id="guard_headshakeno" />Nothing else matters.
<g id="guard_nod" />We have awaited this day for centuries, and our patience will be rewarded.
<g id="guard_gestureleftM" />All of Prydwen will bask in the glory of the bloodline restored! It is our destiny!

These altars in Khalladan, seem to have some power over the Lost. “Power” might be the wrong word. But definitely some kind of influence. 

I can use Moira Chapman’s notes to figure out how to channel their essence. And if I can’t tap into their magic, maybe I can convey them to where they’ll be most useful. 

I must think this plan through to support my True King in the way he deserves. Only then, can I join him.

The Ancients clearly had ways of controlling the Guardians. I wonder if it’s the same magic that powers the altars. 

I found runes here that light up when the Lost come near them. Maybe there are more objects like these within the nearby ruins of Antares, so I shall continue my search there. 

For the True Heir and the restoration of Prydwen's glory, we will find a way to unite behind the royal bloodline once again.
Talk to Sage Moira

<g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />I'm thankful to have found you, young one. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I fear I may have missed some additional clues on the fragments. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />I came after you right away.

"Yes, Lochnir's Research Notes."

<g id="litearmor_shocked" />Lochnir, out here? Studying the ruins? <g id="litearmor_shakehead" />Why, that makes no sense at all! <g id="litearmor_takeitem5s" priority="high"/>Let me see these notes you found...

<g id="litearmor_worry" priority="high"/>These notes are… very troubling. It's hard to say exactly what Lochnir seeks to achieve, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />but it does not seem like it's for the good of Prydwen.
The Mystery of Minister Lochnir
Moira now believes the Ancient tablet was taken from the ruins of Antares. She's asking you to search for any clues relating to the tablet, the Lost, or Minister Lochnir.
"We need to stop him."

<g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Yes, that much is clear. But we cannot leave yet. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />In my further study of the fragments, <g id="litearmor_youknow" />I saw new clues - the tablet's not from Khalladan, but rather Antares.

<g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />I know I've already asked much, and offered poor direction, but Antares is close. <g id="litearmor_pleadhandsopen" />I'm pleading with you, please investigate before we return to Prydwen.
"Alright, I'll visit Antares."

<g id="litearmor_sighrelief" />Whatever you find, come back, and then <g id="litearmor_gestureleft" />we will return to Prydwen, inform the Knight-Regent, and confront Lochnir. <g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />I will wait here. Do hurry.
<g id="litearmor_think" />Controlling the Lost, why would Lochnir want to do such a thing?

At last, my work proves fruitful. The altars and tablets within these ruins have considerable power over the Ancient Guardians.

And today, I've proven they can have a similar effect on the Lost. I had to bind and kill a young squire nearly a dozen times before he finally surrendered his soul, but after he fell... he was easy to control. He will walk wherever this tablet is placed. 

And so will any other Lost nearby. With this staff, I hope I might even amplify this power. All I do, I do for the glory of the True King...
<g id="grace_convince" />You're not going to believe what happened back in the town. That Minister Lochnir… I said he was mad, didn't I? And believe it or not, I was right!
<g id="grace_worry" />I hope the Knight-Regent hasn't gone and gotten herself into trouble. She's awful dry that one, but she's got grit… I respect that!

<g id="litearmor_lifthandsxs" />Your friend Grace has come with dire news from Prydwen, but first, <g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />you have to tell me what you found. Any further clues to Lochnir's plans?

<g id="grace_throwarms" priority="high"/>Is that what the bastard's up to? That's more twisted than even I imagined. <g id="grace_yes" />But it might explain what happened back in Prydwen.

<g id="litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />Now that's not so strange. If Gawain has arrived, it makes sense. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Perhaps this is a misunderstanding, and <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />Lochnir's simply trying to lead the Lost away…

<g id="grace_cajole" />Call yourself a sage? Look past your scrolls to see the man's behavior! Even the Knight-Regent knows Lochnir's gone mad… and let me tell you, <g id="grace_headshakeno" />she's not happy.
Talk to Sage Moira
The True Threat
Grace O'Malley has asked you to share the truth about Lochnir with the Knight-Regent at Preiddeu Farms.

<g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />I don't know she's thinking that far ahead, yet. She just hopped on her horse and rode off, <g id="grace_handheart" />shouting at me to find you and meet her at Preiddeu Farms.

<g id="litearmor_think" />Ah, then she's expecting a fight. Going to find Ser Percilla, <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />a fellow knight and confidant who hasn't come to Prydwen in many moons. <g id="litearmor_worry" />This is serious.

<g id="litearmor_handsonhipsshakeheads" />Though my scrolls may not have all the answers, I <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />might find a way to counteract this sorcery Lochnir seeks to employ. <g id="litearmor_willcoverit" />I should return to town.

<g id="litearmor_agree1" />Very well. If Ser Gawain doesn't arrive soon, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />there may not be a kingdom left for him to rule. <g id="litearmor_nodunderstand" />I hope this all starts making sense soon.
<g id="grace_proud" />The Knight-Regent asked me to scout the eastern farms on the way, so I'll mark Ser Percilla's place on your map and meet you there. <g id="grace_yes" />Good winds to us both.

<g id="grace_bowHead" priority="high"/>Always good to see a friendly face in this mess. <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />It seems we found the wrong part of Aeternum to make a landing, didn't we?

<g id="litearmor_concerns" priority="high" />I pray that this business turns out to be less worrisome than it seems. <g id="litearmor_shrugbrief" />So much hope in the air of late, I'd hate to see it dashed.

Puts my mind at ease... clear, uncomplicated work.

I only raise my sword now to keep the Lost at bay.
Percilla... you're not making any sense.
I… I can’t even say it.
You wouldn’t believe me anyway.
We were naïve to be so hopeful…

We were naïve to be so hopeful…

<g id="female_whattheheck" priority="high"/> I cannot imagine what's come over her! Ser Percilla was Prydwen's most honorable knight, <g id="male_converseleft" />and now, when we need her most, she refuses my orders!

<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />Everyone seems to think Gawain's already assumed command! Lochnir's in outright defiance. <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />He's changed… I don't even know him any more.
"Lochnir was planning all this."
<g id="male_shocked" />Is that what you discovered in the ruins? <g id="female_spreadarms" /> Was Lochnir behind the strange tablet at the mine? The pirates, too?
<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheads" />I am having trouble understanding what his ultimate goal is, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />or if he even has one.
"Is it because of the True Heir?"

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I don't know. <g id="male_think" />I now question everything the Minister said, but the Knights at Teyrnon Keep did meet Ser Gawain… <g id="female_youknow" />Percilla did tell me that much.

<g id="male_nodunderstand" /> Percilla was there, in fact, but she won't talk about it. <g id="male_darnit" priority=""high" />It's infuriating! I need a moment to collect myself. If you are so inclined, <g id="male_converseleft" />you should try and talk to her.

<g id="female_handsonhipsshakeheadS" priority="high" />With Lochnir in outright rebellion and Ser Percilla refusing to speak to me, <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I wonder if I've not been too tolerant, in my time as Regent.

<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" />If you're expecting to have more luck plying me for answers than the Knight-Regent, think again. <g id="female_shrugDontcare" />I don't know you and <g id="male_wavehandDismissive" />I sure as hell don't owe you anything.
Truth be told, <g id="female_notsure" />I don't owe her, either. I've foresworn my oath. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />The politics of Prydwen are no longer my concern.
"What about the Lost threat?"

<g id="male_spreadarmsCalm" /> I'm perfectly capable of defending my land and estate. Outside of that, <g id="male_shakehead" />it's none of my business what goes on, who falls, <g id="male_shrugBrief" />and who doesn't.
Talk to Percilla Wallen

<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" priority="high" />This keep and farm was granted to me by Artorius himself, many centuries ago. <g id="male_willcoverit" />This is where I make my stand, not at Prydwen.

<g id="female_leanpointConvince" /> The knights I served with at Teyrnon Keep were the bravest, most loyal men and women I've ever known. <g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />To think of them as fallen… it's too much to bear.
Broken Oath
The former knight Percilla Wallen suggests you investigate Teyrnon Keep to learn more about the return of the true heir, Ser Gawain.
"All the knights have fallen Lost?"
<g id="female_nodyes" />I believe that to be the case, though some may remain. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I left one day, and I haven't gone back.

<g id="female_explainS" />If you want to know what's happened at Teyrnon Keep, I suggest you go and have a look for yourself. <g id="male_compliment" />Then you can try to explain it to the Knight-Regent.
"Explain what?"
<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> I've said as much as I'm going to say. <g id="female_spreadarms" />You and the Knight-Regent are welcome to shelter here, but I'll answer no more questions.

<g id="male_pointBlame" />If you are going to venture into Teyrnon Keep, I suggest you don't tell the Knight-Regent. <g id="male_shakehead" />It's better she doesn't go there. There's nothing left… <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />for any of us.

<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />To be perfectly clear, I'm not advising you to visit Teyrnon Keep. <g id="male_nodunderstand" />It would be much better to walk away, find another place on Aeternum where you can be safe.

The knights are loyal to the True Heir. He was after all, Artorius’s most trusted knight and nephew, the one who the High King himself put in charge of the circle. 

Ser Gawain looks to me, now, trusting me with his power. He commands me without words. 

Our path is set. He will be crowned with the Circlet of Swords, and watch as the Lost multiply and submit to his glory.
For centuries, the throne has been empty…
Yet you served faithfully, never once questioning your duty.
Now, as the heir returns to claim his rightful place, you have the honor of being the first to kneel before him.
Let us recite the oath:
For the glory of Avalon, I swear my honor and allegiance, To crown and bloodline of the King, For this day, And until the end of eternity.
Behold, the heir of Artorius… HIGH KING GAWAIN…
Be strong, now. I will bestow his blessing…
SWEAR…
For the glory of… ughhh – ARGGGHHH!
NO…! I cannot, I will n-
For centuries, the throne has been empty…
Yet you served faithfully, never once questioning your duty.
Now, as the heir returns to claim his rightful place…
You have the honor of being the first to kneel before him.
Let us recite the oath:
For the glory of Avalon,
I swear my honor and allegiance,
To crown and bloodline of the King,
For this day,
And until the end of eternity.

HIGH KING GAWAIN…
SWEAR…
Be strong, now. I will bestow his blessing…
For the glory of… ughhh – ARGGGHHH!
NO…! I cannot…
I will n--
You have a duty... If the king is here, why aren't you by his side?
I don't belong there.
How can you say that? Your oath is your bond - what could be more important?
My oath was to the king, not a monster...! Damn it! Gawain is… Lost, Jae! A soulless husk! I will not serve such a thing.
Lost...but Minister Lochnir said… he's been preparing...
Lochnir has joined his king in darkness, and so have the other knights.
But… how…. did this come to pass…?
You have a duty... If the king is here, why aren't you by his side?
I don't belong there.
