Your oath is your bond. What could be more important?
My oath was to the king, not a monster...!
Damn it! Gawain is… Lost, Jae!
A soulless husk!
I will not serve such a thing.
Lost…
But Minister Lochnir said he's been preparing...
Lochnir has joined his king in darkness…
And so have the other knights.
How?
How did this come to pass…?
<g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />Gawain is… and Lochnir… I just can't. Forgive me. <g id="female_slumpWhattodo" priority="high" />I need a moment to contemplate what I've just heard.

<g id="male_pointBlame" />Are you happy now? If you've been to Teyrnon Keep, I'm assuming you know the truth. <g id="female_shrugNothingicando" />Ser Gawain is Lost, and he and Lochnir <g id="male_nodunderstand" />intend to rule a Lost kingdom.
"Yes, I found your sword."
<g id="female_takeItem" priority="high"/>Thank you... I suppose, though I have no further need of it. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />My days as a knight are done.

<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> I fought honorably to protect Artorius and his legacy for several lifetimes, but I will<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" /> not follow the heir down this path. Nor will I stand against him.
"Even while Prydwen falls Lost?"
<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />Prydwen is Ser Gawain's right by blood, and though I've foresworn my duty to the bloodline, <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I will not oppose him, even if he is Lost.
Talk to Percilla Wallen

<g id="male_pointBlame" />You forced my hand, you know. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I didn't want to even tell the Knight-Regent. <g id="male_hanghead" priority="high" />To see the shock and disappointment on her face, it re-opens my own wounds.
Kingdom of the Lost
Percilla Wallen has advised you meet Grace and stay informed of her latest findings at Deadman's Shrine.
"I'm sure it's hard for you both."
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Heh, there are some benefits to being new to the island, aren't there? <g id="male_complimentplayer" />Maybe fate has ordained you to be the one to shoulder this burden.

<g id="male_compliment" />If you fought your way into Teyrnon Keep and returned with your soul intact, you are valiant, at least. <g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" />If Jae wishes to fight, she's fortunate to have you.
"She needs you, too."

<g id="male_crossarmsNo" />That's… it's not what I'm going to do. I cannot… <g id="male_darnit" priority=""high" /> I cannot fight in this battle. I-I buried my arms and knight's armor. <g id="male_righthandNodeal" priority="high"/>My fighting days are done.
"It's your choice."

<g id="male_nodSympathySmall" />Thank you for understanding, and for your support of the Knight-Regent.<g id="male_converseleft" /> You should go to her now. I wish… <g id="male_willcoverit" />I hope you both find your way forward.
<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" priority="high" />It's too much to bear. If I dwell on all this, I'll lose hope, and then fall Lost. That may well be the fate of all on Aeternum, in the end.
Talk to Knight-Regent Jin Jae

<g id="female_disappointed" priority="high" />So you've been to Teyrnon Keep, and you saw the horrors Percilla described? I can't imagine. <g id="male_darnit" priority=""high" />Gawain… Lochnir… this is worse than even my darkest fears.
"We stop them. Whatever it takes."

Yes, <g id="female_nodding" />as Knight-Regent, it is my duty to defend the kingdom against all threats. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />Lochnir may believe the kingdom is the bloodline, <g id="male_willcoverit" />but I know it to be the people.

<g id="male_clenchFistRight" />And I will fight for the people of Prydwen until the last shred of my soul is forfeit. <g id="male_compliment" />You have no such duty, but I welcome the support, if you will fight at my side.
"Of course. What do you need?"

<g id="female_youknow" />First priority is ensuring Prydwen is prepared to defend itself against whatever threats emerge. Second, we must look south… <g id="male_lookdownOhmy" priority="high" />oh… what have I done?

<g id="male_rememberBig" priority="high"/>I just realized I sent Grace to scout the southern shore with no idea what she's walking into! <g id="male_pointBlame" />You must go after her, with great haste, lest she walks right into a trap.
"I'll go right now."

<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />Thank you. I will return to Prydwen. As regent, <g id="male_willcoverit" />that's where I belong whether the city stands or falls. I will rally whatever knights remain to our defenses.
"What about Percilla?"

<g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />She'll have to make her own choices.<g id="female_nodyes" /> I must collect myself before I head north. <g id="male_willcoverit" />I'll say our farewells. You should leave now.

<g id="male_compliment" />Find Grace and ensure she's safe. If possible, get a sense of what we're up against and <g id="female_leanpointconvince" />then return to Prydwen and we will make our stand. <g id="male_bowShallow" />Godspeed, my friend.
<g id="g_female_gesturebothhands" /> If you've not found Grace yet, you shouldn't waste a moment. <g id="male_shakehead" />She has no idea the danger she's facing.

<g id="male_concernS" /> I must confess… I fought at Jin Jae's side for centuries and never realized how strong she really is. <g id="male_realize" />Her resolve in the face of this horror… I-I don't know.
<g id="grace_welcome" />About time I got some reinforcements down here! <g id="grace_convince2" />Remember that Lost pirate den in the north? That's a small affair compared to this place.

<g id="grace_headnodyes" />Our good friend Minister Lochnir was here, too. <g id="grace_sympathy" />Those eejits who followed him are all Lost now and under his command. What about you? Learned anything new?
"Ser Gawain is Lost, too."

<g id="grace_throwarms" priority="high"/>What? Ah, you're joking me! This "True Heir" everyone's so excited about <g id="grace_shrugDontcare" />is actually a soulless ghoul…? <g id="grace_yes" />Aha, I guess now the Minister's plan makes sense!
Talk to Grace O'Malley
<g id="grace_understand" />That bastard Lochnir is planning to turn all of Monarch's Bluffs to Lost! <g id="grace_yes" />I guess, though, the scariest part is how close he is to succeeding.

<g id="grace_gestureL" />They're clearly making preparations here to launch an attack on Prydwen. <g id="grace_no" />Hordes of Lost, stockpiles of explosives… <g id="grace_yes" />I'd say they're about to make their move.
The Plot against Prydwen
Stop the Lost fleet from leaving Scallywag Bay. Start with their explosives and then destroy their altar.
"We have to stop them."
<g id="grace_proud" />Well, we've discussed this partnership before, haven't we? I get the lay of the land, and <g id="grace_smackfist" />you do the battling part.
<g id="grace_secret" />You'll be facing long odds, but you're like a lucky anchor. <g id="grace_shrugDontknow" />I'd consider making a wager <g id="grace_yes" />on you, regardless.
"Thanks... I guess?"
<g id="grace_spreadarms" />Not a problem, I'll always tell it to you straight.
<g id="grace_smackfist" />I'd suggest you destroy as many explosives as you can and take out that glowing altar too. <g id="grace_crossarms" />Now, what would you have me do?
"Go warn Prydwen."
<g id="grace_relief" />Now there's an order I don't mind following. <g id="grace_secret" priority="high" />I could use a cup of mead after all this crawling around.
<g id="grace_handheart" />I'll go and tell the Knight-Regent what's what, but my hopes go with you. <g id="grace_yes" />It's better if these bastards never set sail.
<g id="grace_consider" priority="high"/>I'll be heading north, and I hope you'll follow soon. I look forward to hearing your stories at the Prydwen tavern.

<g id="grace_secret" priority="high"/>Word is there's another town to the north where they're filthy with treasure. <g id="grace_think" />I think I'll be heading that way, once everything here's in order.

<g id="yonas_spreadarms002" />Surprised to see me, are you? Brushing the dirt from my armor was no easy task, <g id="yonas_noddingSlow" />but after your friend Grace told me you were here alone, I had to come.
"You'll fight after all?"

<g id="yonas_noddingheadApproval" />My heart was conflicted, but in the end, <g id="yonas_saluteFistchest" />I took an oath as the protector of the kingdom, not a single ruler. <g id="yonas_shakehead" />I won’t forget that again.
<g id="yonas_shrug" />Of course… it seems I arrived too late. <g id="yonas_thinking" />Hearing the ruckus and seeing the smoke, I assume you succeeded in disrupting their war preparations?
"Indeed. Prydwen is safe."
Well, <g id="yonas_rightfist" />there's something to be grateful for, even if I am a little disappointed I missed all the action. <g id="yonas_explain01" />Perhaps we don't stop there.

<g id="yonas_explain02" />You see… I know where Ser Gawain and Lochnir are conspiring in darkness to steal all our souls. <g id="yonas_gestureLeft" />They're in Gawain's ancestral home, Corbenic Castle.
Report back on the sabotage of the Pirates' assault preparations
Corbenic Castle
Percilla Wallen suspects Ser Gawain, the True Heir and Lochnir, the scheming minister, have gone to Corbenic Castle. Meet her there.
"I like where this is going."
<g id="yonas_nodBig" />I thought you might. It is indeed best for Prydwen that the Knight-Regent is safe and fortifying the keep. <g id="yonas_handHeartLove" />You and I are more… expendable.

<g id="yonas_crossarmsShakehead" />Make no mistake, Gawain is every bit a knight of legend, and Lochnir's a diabolical snake. <g id="yonas_shakehead" />This will not be an easy fight, but it is a <g id="yonas_fistsmack" />necessary one.
"You had me at 'expendable'."

<g id="yonas_chuckle" />Hah, then let's get on with it, shall we? <g id="yonas_spreadarms002" />Corbenic Castle is just across the water to the west. <g id="yonas_bowShallow" priority="high"/>I will go ahead and scout the castle's defenses. Don't take long.
Meet me at Corbenic Castle. We'll put an end to all this madness!
Talk to Percilla Wallen

<g id="yonas_gesturebothhands" />Here we are, home to one of King Artorius's greatest knights, and his heir. <g id="yonas_nodSlight" />It was a bastion of valor back then… today, <g id="yonas_shrug" />it's a monument to darkness.
<g id="yonas_gestureRight" />I look to the ramparts and I recognize many knights, now Lost… <g id="yonas_headnodyes" />they were dear friends. <g id="yonas_shakehead" />This will not be easy for me.
Lost Legacy
The time of judgement is nigh. Confront Ser Gawain, the True Heir and the pestilent Minister Lochnir at Corbenic Castle.
"You don't have to come."

No, but I do. <g id="yonas_rightfist" />This is my duty, and I am sworn to it. <g id="yonas_explain01" />You can attack from the gate, and I will use a hidden entrance on the other side of the castle.

<g id="yonas_bowShallow" priority="high"/>Your courage is unquestionable, and I've witnessed your prowess in battle. I will fight my way up from below and we will <g id="yonas_fistsmack" />confront Gawain together.
"Sounds like a good plan."
<g id="yonas_nod" />Gawain and Lochnir must be defeated, whatever it takes. <g id="yonas_saluteFistchest" />Godspeed to us both, friend.
<g id="yonas_nod" />Do what must be done. You're the only one who can stop them!
My Liege, it is now my honor to join you... without reservation.
Raise your sword…
Yeeaaahhh! Geeahhh!
Ha ha ha…
And now you shall be the first to experience the king's justice…
My Lord, I leave this wretch to you…
My Liege, it is now my honor to join you...
Without reservation.
Raise your sword…
Yeeaaahhh! Geeahhh!
Ha ha ha…
And now you shall be the first to experience the king's justice…
My Lord…
I leave this wretch to you…
For the glory of Avalon…
…until the end of eternity.
For the glory of Avalon…
…until the end of eternity.

<g id="yonas_explain01" />I am sorry I arrived late to Gawain's hall. The Lost knights fought fiercely, and with cold resolve. <g id="yonas_noddingSubtle" />I arrived only in time to see Lochnir fall.
Talk to Percilla Wallen
<g id="yonas_spreadarmsNod" />Your courage and valor have spared Prydwen from a dreadful fate.<g id="yonas_plead02" /> The Knight-Regent will undoubtedly want to cover your chest in medals.
A True Leader
Ser Gawain and Lochnir have been vanquished. In the absence of the True Heir, find a True Ruler for the crown.
"She'll remain the Regent now."
<g id="yonas_noddingheadApproval" />Of course. She has led us admirably for many decades now, <g id="yonas_lefthand" />and the people adore her, probably even more after this.
<g id="yonas_shrug" />With Gawain exposed and defeated, however, the question of the True Heir is settled. <g id="yonas_thinking" />It might clear the way for a new monarch.
"Queen Jin Jae has a nice ring to it."
Now that… <g id="yonas_nodBig" />is an excellent idea. I can think of no one more deserving. <g id="yonas_rightfist" />A new queen to lead us into a new age, with new hopes and vision for the future.

<g id="yonas_handHeartLove" />I will go to Prydwen to share Gawain's sorry end, and I will discuss your suggestion. <g id="yonas_gestureLeftM" />You must come, too. If there is to be a coronation, <g id="yonas_noddingheadApproval" />you must attend.
<g id="yonas_shakehead" />Do not tarry here long, my friend. The Lost will return, and even if they're less driven, they will be a threat in numbers.
This is already more fanfare than I had hoped for.
As far as coronations go, I would say this is fairly modest.
A ceremony befitting our humble new queen.
Queen? I'm not sure I'll ever get used to hearing that.
No more stalling, my queen.
People of Prydwen! Honored guests! -
Together we have endured great hardships, but despite it all, a steady hand has guided us through the storm.
May I present to you, Queen Jin Jae of Prydwen!
This is already more fanfare than I had hoped for.
As far as coronations go, I would say this is fairly modest.
A ceremony befitting our humble new queen.
Queen?
I'm not sure I'll ever get used to hearing that.
No more stalling, my queen.
People of Prydwen! Honored guests!
Together we have endured great hardships…
But despite it all, a steady hand has guided us through the storm.
May I present to you…
Queen Jin Jae of Prydwen!
[Cheering]
<g id="yonas_saluteFistchest" />The new Queen will need a Knight-Commander. If she'll have me, <g id="yonas_headnodyes" />I will stand at her side, from now... until the end of eternity.

<g id="male_clasphandsGrateful" />I'm glad you made it. We waited as long as we could. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I think the people of Prydwen <g id="female_nodyes" />wanted to ensure all the preparations for Gawain were put to use.

<g id="male_shakehead" /> But it wouldn't have felt right without you. <g id="male_compliment" />This victory really belongs to you… truly, and <g id="female_nodyes" />Percilla's account of your heroics only reinforces that.
"We all did this together."

<g id="female_chuckle" />Hmmph. I'll take the compliment. <g id="female_shrugnothingicando" />I'll need all the confidence I can get if I'm to rule this land as a monarch. <g id="female_headshakeSmall" />I still haven't quite got used to the idea.
<g id="male_lookaroundBored" priority="high" />I was hoping your friend Grace would make an appearance today, but I guess <g id="female_nodyes" />she meant it when she said she was heading north.
Talk to Regent Jae Jin
<g id="litearmor_think" />Isn't it exciting when historyan unexpected turn? <g id="litearmor_agree1" />I think Queen Jin Jae may prove to be the best ruler Prydwen's ever known.

Well now, <g id="male_compliment" />all's well that ends well, if I may say so. Not the monarch we expected on throne, but a suitable one all the same! <g id="female_cheerFistpump" />Long live Queen Jin Jae!

But what's next for you? <g id="male_complimentplayer" />You would make a fine knight, and we sorely need to rebuild the order, <g id="female_nodshrugokay" />but I also understand if voices are calling you elsewhere.
Wilderness Wiseman
Travel east to Fisherman's Bend to find the Old Man that Jin Jae believes can help expel the Corruption from your mind.
"I hear a voice, it's Corruption."
<g id="female_shocked" />You hear the voice of Corruption? I've heard legends of its insidious torment... <g id="female_sympathyHandsheart" />What an awful burden you must bear! I had no idea…
<g id="female_thinking" />In the days of Artorius, they say it was the voice of Myrddin that called knights to evil. It drove them mad…
"Is there any way to fight it?"
<g id="female_shakeheadNo" />I know of no cure, but there's an old man who comes to Prydwen now and then. <g id="female_shrugShort" />He goes on and on about Corruption.
<g id="male_secretiveshort" />Some say he's deranged, but I see wisdom in his eyes. <g id="female_pointleft" />He fishes the east river. Perhaps if you seek him out, he will help you.
If anyone can help you, it would be that old man. <g id="female_pointleft" />He's often fishing on the river to the east. <g id="female_nodyes" />Look for him there.
<g id="male_shakehead" />Now that I hear about this Corrupted voice in your head, your account from the beach is all the more disturbing.
Seek out the Old Hermit fishing on the East River
[Yonas's lines are in 99A_Objectives.loc. The data sheet points there.]
Welcome to the Bluffs, take rest. Please make this your home. This blighted land will soon be blessed, when the True Heir takes the throne.
Come, Seeker, danger abounds, but your fortune will be grown. The Lost banished, peace found, when the True Heir takes the throne.
The True Heir sought to save us once, and now, the answer they’ll bring.
The Lost will learn, be forever turned. They’ll know them as Our One True King!
Flowers for the Heir
The True Heir is returning to Monarch's Bluffs! Fiona Murphy has asked you to bring Avalon Lilies to Pendragon Landing as a tribute.
“They sound important.”
Mountain and dale speak the tale, a warrior of wit and renown. Artorius raised them strong and brave, a True Heir for his crown.
“How do we welcome them?”
For the Heir, bring flowers fair, that we may build a path of blooms. May they know their people care, it is them we choose.
No tribute too large, no deed too small, when the fated ship comes home.
The True Heir sought to save us once, and now, the answer they’ll bring.
The Lost will learn, be forever turned. They’ll know them as Our One True King!
Talk to Fiona Murphy
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Have you ever held the song of love in your heart?
<g id="female_explainS" />It’s hard to keep your spirits up on the island. But a darling sweeting can make any place feel like home!
<g id="female_explainS" />Love keeps you warm, but so does wool. Come to me, if you ever need something stitched.
<g id="female_explainS" />I've made a fair garment for many a fine folk. Even my darling Eddie, <g id="female_fingerwagNo" />who isn’t back yet!
<g id="female_explainS" />Eddie made life here bearable, you know. Without him… What am I thinking? You don’t have the time to listen to my woes.
The Anniversary Gift
Edda Koning wants you to remind her husband, Eddie Koning it's their anniversary. Carry the message to Cynefin Mine.
“Were you expecting him?”
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Yes, my foolish heart can't help long for my Eddie. He toils too hard in the mines.
This is the first time he’s missed our anniversary!<g id="female_explainS" /> I’d go to the mines myself but his favorite turkey is roasting away.
“I’ll go look for him.”
That’d be lovely! <g id="female_salute2finger" />Tell that oaf he has a wife who loves him more than the mines do.
<g id="female_explainS" />And then, gently remind him that it’s our anniversary today. And I’ll be very cross if he doesn’t have a gift for me.
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Did you find my Eddie yet? Ask him to stop working and get here quickly!
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Oh dear, he’s not with you. That can only mean…
<g id="male_ragepoundfist" />Blast that domkop! I-I- told him to stay with me today. But, no! He had to go to the mines and pick at another rock.
“I’m sorry.”
<g id="female_explainS" />I am sorry too. There will never be another Eddie. <g id="male_patience" />I remember the first time he handed me his coat in the rain. Our first…
<g id="male_spreadhands" />Thank you for bringing me the news, even if it wasn’t what I expected.
Talk to Edda Koning
What wall can keep out despair? Which supplies can help people keep their faith?
I know how to keep the Lost out of the settlement. I don't know how to judge which of our brethren are going to turn.
I’d help you settle in, but I’m the one who needs help right now.
We've lost men, lost equipment. I have to build strong defenses for the Regent and her people, but how can I do that without resources?
Pick of the Mines
Prydwen is short on resources. Cemal, the Master Builder has asked you to retrieve the miners' picks so that he may melt them into iron.
"How can I help?"

I wish that you could retrieve the miners, such hard workers all of them, all equipped with picks that date back to Artorius's reign. Maybe you could retrieve the heirloom picks? I'd be most appreciative.
Did you get all the miners' picks? Each one if an heirloom with cuts rocks with ease. It will be simpler to train you with them.
…8, 9, 10. The miners' heirloom picks are all here, all accounted for and in good condition.
This will be a big aid to building our defenses. How can I thank you for this?
“It was nothing really.”
Hah. You have my friendship, rajal sadaq. And my time. And an odd job if you ever have need of one.
We are always on the lookout for honest, hardworking people. And you strike me as being one.
Talk to Cemal Qadir
Did the pesky pirates give you trouble when you first arrived on these shores?
Someone has got to stop these bearded meanies! And that someone is me!
Have you ever met such coordinated pirates? It’s like they went to school or something.
How will people ever find their way to Prydwen, if they can’t even survive this beach?
Destroyer-of-Pirates, you've earned my gratitude!
Let's keep protecting those who newly arrive here and one day, we may be made knights for our efforts!
Blow 'Em Down!
Squire Ashe needs your help to blow up a bunch of pirates at Brysedd Shore.
“When did you come to the island?”
I was a baby. And an absolute terror. Folks here say I used to leap out from behind trees and startle them.
My bag had a fleur-de-lis. And I spoke a little French back then.
“A fleur-de-lis? You sound royal.”
Royal? Hah! Hardly. I just want to make these pirates cry for their mothers.
If only they didn’t have so many weapons and barrels of gunpowder…
“Let's use the barrels against them.”
Hah! What a good way to turn the barrels on them! Sneak up on the pirates, light their barrels, and then BOOM! Pirates blown to pieces!
I’ll keep watch here and make sure no one foils our grand plan!
What are you waiting for? Blow up the pirates, already!
Hah! That was magnifique! You're handy with gunpowder barrels! Had Ser Payne witnessed this, he might have even made you a squire!
“Is that how you became a squire?”
Oui! Ser Payne sees the spark of a knight in me. I have to train more. And fight more. And impress the Regent...
But, you’ll see! I’ll become a knight soon! Then everyone will call me Ser Ashe!
Talk to Squire Ashe
Oh, I'm a sad man who has made many a poor decision, like deciding to come here.
The island has ripped out my heart and fed her to the Lost, while I was sleeping.
Did you venture forth for freedom or fame? I came here to live happily with my sweetheart, a Moorish woman.
We both fled from impending execution for our forbidden love. Who knew I’d one day crave death like water in the desert?
Fatimah will be delighted with this mirror. I can sense a bit of magic in it already.
I wonder why she was so insistent I put it together. Maybe, I'll find out soon.
A Wife's Mirror
A wistful Hugo Molina has asked you to help him find the missing fragments of his Lost wife's mirror.
“Is eternal life that bad?”
It is when you’re the reason your woman is no more. Even the moon burns you. Fatimah’s soul gave up on me.
She came to me in a dream the other day and asked me to piece together this mirror. But I don’t have all the fragments.
“I’ll help you find them.”
Would you? Fatimah said if I piece this mirror for her, she'll finally find peace, the peace I stole from her.
We were so happy once, but all the sacrifices we made... Have you ever been with someone and yet felt so alone?
Did you have any luck with the missing fragments of Fatimah's mirror?
Gracias, kind soul! Fatimah always loved her mirrors. With this last fragment, she can have her final one.
She said mirrors have a certain magic to them. And I can sense the energy in this, almost a strange calling…
Talk to Hugo Molina
Have you ever observed the Lost? They look sad but they could be secretly peaceful.
Imagine if the most beautiful music played inside their minds. And they just can’t tell us about it.
How does it feel to be alive, stranger? To know you cannot die?
I used to dig graves in Bavaria but obviously, I couldn't do that here. I survived on scraps for a while until I devised a new livelihood.
A lot of people passed right by me before you stopped and offered me assistance.
Olde Geiser will remember you for your kindness always. May you go far on the island!
An Olde Tale
Help Olde Geiser provide the families of the Lost with some peace. Collect Crystalline Tears and Glittering Stones for him to build memorials with.
“What's your new calling?”
I craft Lost memorials from Crystalline Tears, to soothe grieving families.
Peace is always in demand. Many ask me for my services. But, the Crystalline Tears are over and so, the tears of people must wait.
“Anything I can do to help?”
Hmm. You look more limber than me. You may have luck with these ruins.
If you can brave the eldritch dangers and gather some Crystalline Tears for me, I’ll give you a good portion of what I got from the families.
Did the ruins reveal their secrets and shed their tears for you? Not yet? Well, may your sight be sharp and your pick be purposeful.
So many tears, such little time. You've done well by bringing these Crystalline Tears.
You will be in the thoughts of many families when they say the final prayers for their kin.
Talk to Olde Geiser
How are you adapting to this land, traveller? Have you grown up with tales of knights or like me, is it all a bit mysterious to you?
My mother misses the Joseon court. She understood what was expected of her there.
As royal ladies, we've always been protected. We led lavish lives in the Joseon court and for a while, in Ebonscale Reach.
It's the first time we're living out in the wilds, like common folk. We're trying to adapt.
A free life is better than a royal one, traveler.
The last thing I want is a pair of shackles around these heels. Maybe one day, I'll convince my mother.
Are you betrothed to anyone? I’m struggling to convince Nabi to get married.
She mustn’t meet a horrendous fate. I wouldn’t be able to live with myself.
The Maidens Lost
Nabi has asked for evidence to prove getting married is not the answer to turning Lost. Hopefully, this will get her meddlesome marriage-minded mother off her back.
“You've always been royal?”
Yes. Once upon a time, I was even destined to be queen. But I lost my betrothed to the sea on our way to the island.
My mother hasn't given up hope I will be married one day. She fears the worst if I don't.
“What does your mother fear?”
That I'll turn into a Lost, like the ones who haunt this island, a creature with no purpose but to haunt women with better prospects.
Mother grew up with tales of the virgin ghost. It's hard to shake her out of her belief.
“Some of the Lost were married.”
My mother will have your ear off with all her arguments. For now, I'll surrender to the shadow of her blind belief. Unless-
Do you think there's a way you could bring back artifacts to prove some Lost used to be married?
Wedding rings and love letters, hmm... So, some of the Lost used to be married once? That makes no sense.
And you're saying that even getting married doesn't keep you from turning into one of these creatures? How disturbing!
“No, but you could make a charm.”
A talisman to ward off evil spirits? What a clever idea! Why don't you use the wedding rings?
Maybe they'll influence Nabi and she’ll want to get married sooner.
Did you find any items that show some of the Lost used to be married once?
A talisman? To protect me from evil and lower my chances of turning into a ghost?
Does this mean my mother no longer believes marrying is protection against turning into the Lost?
“She still wants you to be married.”
And my mother will always want that.
If she ever turned into a Lost, which I hope she never does, she'd follow me around with the sole purpose of getting me married. And probably scare all my suitors away!
Talk to Nabi Jeong
Oh, hello! Haven’t died many times, have you? You have gorgeous pearly whites. Dying spoils teeth.
Show me your smile. Your teeth are radiant. Do you use Miswak to brush them?
In the Ottoman Empire, everyone had good teeth. Here, not so much. Here, people eat whatever they get.
If you ever lose all your teeth, you know who to find. You may lose your soul but you'll never lose your smile!
Dentistry Artistry
Hamza Killic's brain is dancing with a new idea. Collect wolf fangs so that he may bring his invention to life!
“How long have you been here?”
More days than a snail has teeth. I left to pursue my great ideas in my reckless youth.
I still feel as reckless and almost as young. And if I can get enough wolf teeth, I'll finally be able to craft my invention!
“How many wolf teeth do you need?”
I already have twenty-six pearly white wolf fangs. I need six more, just like them.
They should be from robust middle-aged wolves, warriors, if you can spot them. Could you get the teeth for me? I'll be grateful!
Did you get the six wolf teeth like I asked? I’ll be able to complete my brilliant invention then. Trust me, you've never seen anything as daring as this!
You spotted the wolves well - middle-aged, strong, aggressive fighters most likely.
These are the perfect fangs. They're sparkly. They're white. They can cut through meat!
“What are you inventing with them?”
The first-of-its-kind dental weapon for the toothless elderly among us, those who have the punch but lack the bite.
One chomp from these pearly beauties will make an attacker regret their choices. Brilliant, no?
Talk to Hamza Killic
My home has been destroyed. My father has been twisted into a monster I can't recognize. I can't even afford a place to sleep.
No one can save me. And nobody will.
I have been ruined. I can't work like I once used to.
What good are hands when your mind is occupied by the demons that plague your dreams?
My father had his time with me and he squandered it. I have no time for his sentiments now.
At least his glassworks have fetched a good price.
Heart of Glass
A grieving Olivia Barovier has asked you to retrieve her Lost father's glassworks from Arruda Ranch.
“What demons?”
Scars. My father's mistakes wore him down till he broke. He always thought the world was better... He shattered when he saw the truth.
He lost himself in making glassworks. People came from all over the island to buy them.
"Sounds like he was talented."
He had a deep relationship with glass, knew exactly which mineral would elicit the color he desired.
His works were treasures that brought hope. But now they're lost in a house filled with horrors.
“I could get his things for you.”
Would you? I can’t step foot in that house. There, there are too many memories…
It isn't easy to be second place in your father's eyes. Please just get the glassworks, if you can.
Were you able to enter the house? Did you find my father’s glassworks?
Getting into the house must not have been easy. I am grateful for your courage.
These are the last things I have of my father. At least he got to spend his last days with his precious work.
“He expressed his feelings.”
He wrote me letters? I'll read his words, although I am fearful of what they may reveal.
Isn't it ironic that my emotions are as fragile as his glass? At least his works have value.
Talk to Olivia Barovier
What folly we have committed! We unleashed a most tragic magic by giving in to Fatimah's whims.
We made a talking mirror that berates me for my decisions, every minute, every hour, every day. It just doesn’t stop!
May you find what you’re looking for, friend. May your wishes be fulfilled without ever being twisted.
Ending the Madness
Fixing the mirror for Hugo worsened matters. He needs your help breaking the large mirror at Deadman's Cove, so that he can finally let go of his Lost wife.
“Have you tried breaking it?”
I had to. Her words are still pounding in my head.
I broke her heart. And now I've broken her mirror. Maybe that's why she won't stop haunting me.
“Do you have happy memories of her?”
Si! I do. Fatimah was the joy of my soul once. I left Spain, left my family because of my love for her.
I loved my querida even when we fought. Even when her cloudy gray eyes turned into a storm.
“Hold the memory. Break the mirror.”
You are right. She speaks through another large mirror in the cove that's filled with pirates.
I'll need your help to break it. But I must get her taunts out of my head.
Were you able to destroy the mirror or did Fatimah's voice get to you too? My Fatimah can be quite compelling.
How is it that you can love someone and yet living with them can slowly destroy you?
This island didn’t help. But oh, Fatimah, I miss you so much.
Talk to Hugo Molina
This island is filled with trials. So be prepared to learn who you really are.
Man is like pepper — you only know him when you’ve ground him.
It was nothing short of a plague. They kept coming in droves, and it was all we could do to hold them back.
I was sure faith had a role to play here, as it does in the tales back home.
It was nothing short of a plague. They kept coming in droves, and it was all we could do to hold them back.
I was sure faith had a role to play here, as it does in the tales back home.
I hope you keep an open heart on this island. I fear it's too late for me. One who has been bitten by a snake lives in fear of worms.
A Useless Hope
Dayo Musa's hopeful plan went horribly wrong. Retrieve the amulets from the Lost to put them at ease and return the amulets to him.
(Keep reading)
I tried to guide the people towards their faith, by giving them something tangible to focus on.
I made sure each of them had an amulet to see them through. Like the stories of old, we’d weather this plague together.
(Keep reading)
They trusted me and I let them down.
I should have gone into this with clearer eyes, and because of my failure, they have all fallen. I, Dayo Musa, must find someone strong to gather their amulets and give them proper rites…
The journals of Dayo Musa should really be discussed with him.
Hello, friend! I hope this day is treating you with kindness.
Would you have time to help a fellow? Regrettably, the people I was trying to protect have turned into the Lost…
"I have your journal."
May fortune be with you! I'd come to the settlement to find help. But no one had time to listen.
It takes a special person to go out of their way to help someone else. Did you find everyone's amulets?
“I did. Here they are.”
Thank you, friend. You have put my mind at ease.
The problems on this island are larger than those I've experienced. And one can't use their hand to force the sun to set.
Talk to Dayo Musa
I will follow the path of my ancestor, Ser Margot Dubois. I’ll become a knight worthy of her praise!
Margot Dubois the Steadfast, knighted by Artorius, seated in the fifth seat of the Round table.
The Resolved Scout, Keeper of the Scepter, Crest of the Lark, bequeathed this day on a scarf of olive silk.
Margot Dubois the Steadfast, knighted by Artorius, seated in the fifth seat of the Round table.
The Resolved Scout, Keeper of the Scepter, Crest of the Lark, bequeathed this day on a scarf of olive silk.
The Aspiring Knight
Ashe Dubois, Ser Payne's squire, has always longed to be a knight. Give her the proof that someone in her family used to be a knight once.
(Keep reading)
The helm, the bow, and the crest of Margot will mark the Dubois family history.
Through generations, the Dubois name will be welcome in the halls of Artorius. They must be informed that they can uphold this honor.
The proclamation concerning the Dubois Family Crest should should be taken to Ashe Dubois.
Really? You found something that belonged to my family! What is it? Who are they? Where can I meet them?
“A Dubois lady was a famous Knight.”
Ooh! Give me that! She was a prestigious knight in the time of Artorius himself. I can’t believe it.
This knight business runs in my blood! Thank you for bringing this to me. I’m going to keep it as a reminder.
Talk to Squire Ashe
Are you betrothed to anyone? I’m struggling to convince Nabi to get married.
She mustn’t meet a horrendous fate. I wouldn’t be able to live with myself.
I came here from the north, believing this place would be better. Instead, I found a den of snakes in the guise of chivalry.
“Someone cheat you?”
A stranger promised me shelter in exchange for information about a knight.
They did the unspeakable and didn't even live up to their promise. Everyone’s going to turn Lost soon and there’s nothing anyone can do about it.
I knew there was a great elsewhere out there, where chivalry hadn’t died an untimely death.
I found it! Here, I can put my ignoble past behind me and take up the glorious burdens of knighthood!
“You want to be a knight?”
It's been my lifelong dream! Being a knight in a mystical land full of monsters and magic!
I’m going to look for some exotic flowers soon. Then I can gift them to a fair maiden and fight in her name!
My peers are probably having a good time fishing somewhere on the island, sharing tales of the Old World.
Meanwhile, I’ve barely made it out of a monster-ridden mine with my skin intact.
“Why be a miner?”
I thought it would be adventurous. I didn’t want to sit by a lake all day.
Well, I’ve had my fill of monsters, funny rocks, and illusions caused by foul air. I wanted a new job! And I got one!
“What’s your new job?”
Mineworks Advisor for the Regent. She’s upset about what happened to us at the mines.
She’s going to make sure the mines are safe for all hardworking miners. And she wants my help to do it!
Thanks for rescuing us! When I was surrounded by the Lost, I remembered everyone who’d ever told me I shouldn’t venture out on my own.
Beating the odds felt good. It made every decision I’ve ever made feel right in a way.
“I'm sure you feel vindicated.”
Well there's so much uncertainty when faced with the soulless. I don’t know how the Regent does it.
She's normally so good at making decisions for all of us. It puzzles me why she didn’t get to us sooner.
Do you know what happened with Allya’s messages? The Regent would have never taken that much time to send help.
The first time I came here, she called me to Court, just to make me feel welcome.
“You like the Regent?”
Who doesn’t like her? She used to visit the mines weekly before people started turning into the Lost.
She probably spends entire nights trying to figure out why this is happening. It's like the puzzle of the rocks.
“The rocks have a puzzle?”
Oh, yes! The mysteries of a land are in its dirt. How does Azoth travel? What remains of the people who lived here once?
I’ll solve the mysteries of this island one mineral vein at a time. It’s a most fascinating conundrum!
What'll it be, friend? A drink to wash away your sorrows, or a drink to celebrate the gift of life?
There's always a good reason to knock one back, if you ask me.
Hey, are you the one I've been hearing about? Yes, you must be. You match the description. People talk around here, you know.
Devil Honey
Get combs of Devil's Honey from Geertie Lother's private reserve at Hiraeth Lookout and return them to her in Prydwen.
"What do people say, exactly?"
They say you've been quite a help, and I was like, "Well, why haven't they helped me?"
But then I realized, silly Geertie, it's because you haven't asked!
"Something you need help with?"
Yes! Honey! Honey so delicious it's called "Devil's Honey." I have a special reserve up on Hiraeth Lookout.
Collect my honeycombs, and I'll give you some to taste.
You’ll find the honeycombs at Hiraeth Lookout. Just wait until you taste this honey!
Aha! There's my honey! Er, I mean my honeycombs. I wasn't calling you "my honey." That would be... absurd.
But yes, this is fantastic! I'm going to whip us up some honeycakes right away.
Talk to Geertie Lother
You did me a good turn with my "Devil's Honey." I'm thinking I might have another favor to ask, if you've got the time.
Oh yeah, I can feel the party coming on already! We got wine and honeycakes - it's gonna be a feast!
Old World Wine
Celebrate while you still can. Collect jars of Old World wine from Brysedd Shore and share them with Geertie Lother.
"Depends on the favor."
Seeing as how everyone is talking about "battening down the hatches" here to protect against the Lost, I think we need to stock up on spirits.
And I think I might know a spot to get our hands on some perfectly aged wine from the Old World.
"Where would this wine be?"
Brysedd Shore! Grab as many jars of wine as you can find there.
We'll celebrate a little, while we still have the time. Who knows what will happen tomorrow?
Stars above! The Old World wine from Brysedd Shore! I can't wait. Pirates sure have all the best stuff!
Oh yeah, I can feel the party coming on already! We got wine and honeycakes - it's gonna be a feast!
Talk to Geertie Lother
Let me give you a tip, rajal sadaq. No one cares where you came from. We care about what you can do.
The Regent made me her Master Builder after she saw my work. Though she probably regrets that now…
Resources for Prydwen
Collect Stone, Wood and Leather for Cemal Qadir, Prydwen's Master Builder, so that he can build good defenses for Prydwen.
“Why would you say that?”
Well, I've run into some supply troubles. I was expecting a shipment of stone, timber, and leather this week.
Nothing’s turned up yet. I fear the poor souls I found to help me may have turned into the Lost.
“I can procure your resources.”
Oh! Would you? That’d be most excellent!
You’d need to cut trees to gather wood, and crush rocks to extract stone - there’s a lot to teach you. But you seem up to the task.
Did you get everything? Not one hair of leather should be missing. Every resource counts towards fortifying Prydwen’s defenses.
Great! You brought exactly what I needed, the right type and the right amount. Were you always this resourceful?
“I've been told I can be handy.”
Haha! You’re a good person, rajal sadaq. You're going to do very well here on Aeternum. I hope to see more of you.
Talk to Cemal Qadir
Have you made friends here? You seem like someone a person would be lucky to call a friend.
Back home in Syria, we always repay favors. You’ve helped me a lot. I hope I can return the favor.
A lot of people have been telling me great things about you. I hope you know, you’ll have many friends here, if you choose to stay.
A Sword for a Friend
Cemal Qadir is very happy with the work you've done and wants to do something for you in turn. Learn how to build a sword with his guidance.
“One good turn deserves another.”
Words to live by, rajal sadaq! You could be knight material and I want to see you make it through a few more summers, at least.
Has anyone taught you how to make a sword?
“Not yet.”
I suppose I must do everything around here. I'm sure that once I teach you to make a sword, you’ll be able to supply armories.
You have that industrious look about you.
Craft me the best sword you can! I want to see what you’re capable of!
That's a fine-looking sword, rajal sadaq. It would almost rival the swords in Syria.
I'm not surprised. It’s what I've come to expect from you.
“I learned from the best.”
Hah! Drop by at the tavern, anytime you want a drink, alright? I'll tell you stories of the High King Artorius you wouldn’t believe!

Helvan the Navigator
The Navigator’s Stronghold
Helvan and his crew are planning to attack Prydwen. Defeat Helvan and destroy his treasured shrine.
Destroy the Ominous Altar to draw out Helvan the Navigator.
Defeat Helvan's Lackeys

Defeat Helvan the Navigator
Helvan guards an ancient altar in Traitor's Hold. Tread carefully, for Helvan's deceptive ambushes are known far and wide, upon the seas.
Corruption will claim them all. Warning them is a futile effort. They are blind to the real danger all around them...
Corruption will claim them all. Warning them is a futile effort.
They are blind to the real danger all around them…
You see? They are all corrupt in their own way. Whether they know it or not, they are already welcoming my embrace…
You see? They are all corrupt in their own way.
Whether they know it or not, they are already welcoming my embrace…
Look how they fall in line when they realize something greater than them is at their doorstep. It will be the same with Corruption…
Look how they fall in line when they realize something greater than them is at their doorstep.
It will be the same with Corruption…
So, you've stopped the Lost's conquest of this kingdom. I have to wonder - are you sure you've really helped these people?
So, you've stopped the Lost's conquest of this kingdom.
I have to wonder - are you sure you've really helped these people?
Burn, you lily-livered loon!
Scamper starboard, you dirty dog!
Flee portside, you fat rat!
Ahoy, me hearty!
Hah, a short-lived victory! Soon, you will be like me.
Go near the altar, matey? Over my body.
Bilge-sucker, beware of what you do not know.
Dirty rat, destroy His altar and you will wish you could die.
You cannot stand against the true vision for these lands!
You should have rallied under the True Heir!
Enough of this! I will see you destroyed in the name of the True King!
Your attempts to harm me only lead to your own demise!
How could I have failed?
The True King will avenge me!
You will serve the True King in death!
Fool! I have the power here!
Witness the might of the Hand of the King!
Ser Gawain
Fall Of The True Heir
Ser Gawain, the True Heir, is Lost! Vanquish him and reclaim the Circlet of Swords.
Defeat Ser Gawain
Defeat Minister Lochnir
Defeat Ser Gawain
Destroy Ser Gawain's Idols
Break Ser Gawain's Altar
Defeat Ser Gawain
I’ve returned to claim what is mine. I bear this burden for the good of all!
These lands are mine by right and decree. Who are you to stand against me?
Why do you persist? I must claim these lands to protect them! It is my right!
Your disrespect for a holy relic sickens me. I will see that you atone!
Do you hold nothing sacred? Justice will be done by my hand!
The divine power to rule and see justice done is still mine.
Am I already through the mists? Have I been damned all along?
What are you lot doing here? Come to steal what is mine? Have at you!
This isn’t the last you’ve seen of Esteban! The seas will be mine one day!
These lands are mine! I’ll see you all driven from them!
I won’t suffer no squatters on my property! Get! Get! All of you!
Vagrants trying to take what’s ours? Oh, no you won’t!
I’ll be back… with more help next time! You’ll see…
Hold on to the spark of hope within you. It will keep you safe in the darkness of despair.
The Regent is blessed and will find a way to save us all.
You're a Marauder, yes? So tell me how is Rodger…Commander Purcell? Is he in good health?
What type of fantasy are you weaving yourself today? So much focus on searching for something that is right under your nose.
Now that you have joined in our cause, you must carry the light into the world at every chance.
Missions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
Have you seen the wonders around you? Look more closely and you will see the science behind them.
The island is like a school to the thirsty mind.
Ok, Marauder. The name is "Tuit", not "twit". And tell that child of a Commander that he needs to grow up.
It is you and your cult who are missing the plot. The Syndicate will reveal all in due time.
Now that you have officially joined in our enterprise, you should always seek ways to advance our interests.
Missions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
We are forged in the fire and quenched in the blood of battle. Only the strong and brave can be Marauders.
Go on and look into the other factions. You'll see that the Syndicate are weak and the Covenant naïve.
Stand strong. Don't give in to the Lost. We will overcome this together. The Regent will see to it.
Typical of the Syndicate to get in over your heads. Best learn to swim as you'll get no help from me.
I harbor you no ill will, though I feel uneasy when your Adjudicator is near. Her eyes. . . They drill right through me.
We are strongest together. Let us endeavor to bring victory to the Marauders.
Now that you have officially joined our ranks, we expect you to seize every opportunity to gain honor.
Missions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
Welcome to 'The Regent's Rise'! Sleep here and wake up feeling like a king! You here to check in? Be my guest… literally!
I've heard the talk around town, people saying things are safer around here.
Not sure I believe it. I might just pick up and head south one of these days.
You know, I'm never one to turn away a good paying customer.
But you've been here long enough - might want to look into buying a house, making this permanent.
"Why should I buy a house?"
I mean, you're always welcome here in the inn, but a house offers some amenities.
You can furnish the place, of course, and if you get yourself killed somehow, you can be resurrected right in the comfort of your own home!

Tablet Fragments
The remains of the smashed runed tablet. The stone is brittle, like a sandstone.
Helvan's Blunderbuss
This weapon seems exceptionally well-made, with treated wood and polished bronze adorning the chassis.
Altar Shard
A chunk that fell off the mysterious altar in Traitor's Hold. The altar seemed to have lost its power, but this piece still resonates with a faint energy.
Hawk's Seal
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a hawk.
Crane's Seal
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a crane.
Sparrow's Seal
An ornate seal, emblazoned with a gold etching. This one is of a sparrow.
Circlet of Swords
A simple but beautiful crown. It looks like it is made with pure iron with gold lining the top.
Lochnir's Staff
This staff is made from a single piece of shaped wood with some small runes etched along the side. The top of the staff appears to have been added on more recently.
Avalon Lily
A beautiful white lily with a brilliant yellow plume inside.
Keepsake Key
A small silvered key. It's slightly scuffed, as if its owner kept it with them all of the time.
Miner's Pick
This pick looks weathered and worn, but it is incredibly sturdy. The tip seems sharp in spite of the scuffs and scratches.
Mirror Shards
A sliver of a blackened mirror.
Crystalline Tear
A sparkling jewel. It needs some work to really bring out the beauty hidden inside.
Soft Gold Ring
A fairly plain golden wedding ring.
Nabi's Notes
A set of scribbled notes, signed by Nabi.
Sharp Canine
A strong wolf canine. It seems incredibly sharp.
Parchment Letters
Although written on a flimsy parchment, the words in this letter appear to be meticulously written.
Ornate Glass Sculpture
A beautiful glass ornament, carefully crafted by skilled hands.
Protective Amulet
A symbol of faith, intended to protect the bearer.
Devil's Honey
Special honey, made by bees who live up on Hiraeth Peak.
Mist Wine
Where this wine is brewed is something of a mystery, but the citizens of Prydwen consider it to be a delicacy.
The Town Project Board
Visit the Town Project Board of Monarch's Bluffs and find tasks to help the people of the settlement.
Visit the Monarch's Bluffs Town Project Board
Who knew that getting stabbed would hurt so much! Even on this island where death holds no sway, the dying still hurts!
Miserable thieves! Killing me is one thing, but stealing my life's work? Idioti! It was my own fault. Foolish, Giacomo! Curse my trusting soul! This means no Traveler's Rest…
It was my own fault. Foolish, Giacomo! Curse my trusting soul! This means no Traveler's Rest...
You're cunning and resourceful. I like that. But do you truly understand my work? Four walls, a roof? That's not a home! Safety, warmth, comfort. Now that's a home!
Four walls, a roof? That's not a home! Safety, warmth, comfort. Now that's a home!
Now, on to business. Walls are simply not enough to provide safety here. The ruins on this island are a testament to that. For the Traveler's Rest to be successful, there must be more.
For the Traveler's Rest to be successful, there must be more.

Thanks to your keen eye, I can get started. Eh dannazione! According to this, blood and bones will only defend against the Withered's physical forms. There are still spirits to address. Eh, Grave Nettles would do the trick.
There are still spirits to address. Eh, Grave Nettles would do the trick.

Ah, my good and dear friend! You have returned at the perfect time! I continue to make progress, but two problems have arisen: I received word from Cutlass Keys that another of my treacherous workmen was spotted in the area.
I continue to make progress, but two problems have arisen: I received word from Cutlass Keys that another of my treacherous workmen was spotted in the area.
We've done something wonderful here, you and I. I'll tell others and invite them to rest. Then the work continues! The future of this island will improve. You have the word of Giacomo Altoviti!
Then the work continues! The future of this island will improve. You have the word of Giacomo Altoviti!
Bravo! You've found me again! As you can see, I've found another location.
This time I planned ahead and brought everything I needed... except... well, I will trust you with this revelation.

For now, two sites for the Traveler's Rest will have to do. I've delayed dealing with Airic long enough. It's time he answers for his betrayal. You've already dealt with two of the traitors... I ask for your help with their leader.
You've already dealt with two of the traitors... I ask for your help with their leader.
The problems with my treacherous workmen are finished. But the journey toward Aeternum's future is just beginning!
"What's so great about owning a house?"
Mah! Now, what kind of question is that? What's not great about homeownership?
A place to store your belongings, a reliable place to fast travel and respawn. Why, it's simply madness not to own a home if you have the gold.
"What did you mean about storage for my home?"
Storage? You know, places to store your things?
When you place that chest I gave you into your home, you'll have even more room to store whatever you need - armor and weapons, furnishings, herbs and spices… whatever you fancy!
"What is a 'trophy'?"
I can't make them all that well, but with some effort on your part, you should be able to.
They provide a link to the island itself, and provide benefits that you can't otherwise obtain. Even better, the benefits follow wherever you are!
Down Payment
Track down the workers who betrayed Giacomo
"Traveler's Rest? What's that?"
A place of rest for weary travelers, of course! I am Giacomo Altoviti, architect. Perhaps you have heard of me? No?
Well, you would have if my workmen hadn't stabbed me in the back - literally - and run off with my design notebook and tools.
"What's so important about these designs?"
So many survivors on this island have no home, no roots. I long to provide that for them.
Safety is always the biggest concern. I can create that safety, on a much smaller scale.
"Is that why your workmen betrayed you?"
The bastardi left me with nothing. But you're here, so there's hope! The Innkeep saw workers a few days ago discussing a notebook of 'secrets.' Suspicious, no?
If you begin the hunt, I'll finish business here and follow!
Your aid is welcome, friend. Once we have my notebook, I have such plans. It will change all of Aeternum! And you will be greatly rewarded, fear not!
Is that my notebook? Oh, grazie! And what of those bastardi who stabbed me and stole it?
The one who had it was Corrupted! Hah! A fitting end to his greed and treachery!
"What's next for you?"
Now the work begins! The safety of a Traveler's Rest will welcome those weary from their journeys.
My goal is for everyone on Aeternum to have a home of their own. And to that end, take this for your own home, friend.
Search for the traitors first campsite
Search for the 'Traitor's Path' journal entry
Continue tracking the traitors to the second campsite
Search for the 'Burning Greed' journal entry

A Major Purchase
Purchase a home, and place some decorations within
"A home does sound nice."
It is sanctuary! A haven that beckons after a long day. It anchors you to the land. And spirit shrines can deposit you gently inside from anywhere on the island!
To truly understand, you must purchase a home of your own.
"Isn't a home... expensive?"
Friend, opportunity abounds here! Look around and you'll find prospects for coin.
Once you have a home, use the furniture I've given you. Create your own space. Then return, for more work remains to be done!
Raising the capital for your first home may not be easy, but I promise you, the benefits are worthwhile.
Good friend, you have returned! And looking stronger and more prosperous than before. You have made your purchase, yes?
"It took some time, but I now have a home."
Bravo! Now you see that everything is better with a home. With that understanding, we may continue our relationship.
Oh, and here's a little housewarming gift. Congratulazioni!
Buy a house and raise your decoration score above 1
Insuring the Investment
Travel to Shatterwall and the Fong Family Orchard to collect fresh Withered blood and bones for Giacomo
"You mean guards and defenses?"
Eh, of a sort. I have selected the site to prepare the foundation, but I'll need a few things.
An associate in First Light gave me a recipe to work the blood and bones of those Withered... things... into the mortar.
"Why in the world do we need that?"
It acts as a repellent. I tried getting these items myself but an architect has limits. I'm certain you're up to the task!
Nearby are two locations that should suffice. Meet me at the site when you've acquired what's needed.
To be honest, I'm not entirely certain how the bones and blood will work, but my Survivalist friend swears by it. I figured better safe than sorry, no?
Welcome to the site of the first Traveler's Rest! It may not seem much right now, but I promise you... it will be! Now, have you gathered those grisly bits I needed?
"I have what you needed, and more."
Perfetto, grazie! Wait, this is my recipe... how did this...? It must have fallen from my notebook during my retreat.
Thank the Madonna you found this! Eh, it seems the recipe requires more than just the blood and bone.
Travel to {POITags} to collect Fresh Withered Blood for Giacomo
Travel to {POITags} to collect Fresh Withered Bones for Giacomo
Collect {itemName}
Search the farmhouse for the "Defense Against the Withered" journal entry
Insuring the Investment (Part 2)
Gather Grave Nettles from Nettlerest Graveyard, and bring them back to Giacomo
"Grave Nettles?"
Si, a plant that grows on and around gravesites. Some people still go through the ceremony for those who have become Lost.
There is a graveyard east of here that should have what we need.
"Care to come along?"
Eh, no, my talents lie in building not fighting. Besides, I should prepare the foundation and have it ready for your return.
Scuse, I do not mean to impose on you, but I am certain that when you see the result, you will be amazed.
See my accomplishment? Amazing progress, no? The foundation is almost finished.
I even had time to add storage for supplies! Did you recover the Grave Nettles?
"Yes, enough for whatever you need."
Bravo! Perfetto! Working these into the floor and walls should keep those terrible spirits from intruding on our guests.
Oh, and the storage I mentioned? You can add this to your own home! Try it with this!
Travel to {POITags} to harvest Grave Nettles for Giacomo
Gather {itemName} near gravesites in {POITags}
Site Inspection
Gather the construction materials for Giacomo, and investigate the information on the next traitor
"That's only one problem."
Si, si! I'm also running short of materials. I had planned this project with a work crew behind me, but we saw how that turned out.
Well, until it is completed, someone must remain here to defend the site. I have a list of what I need, if you're willing?
"I'll see what I can find."
Grazie mille, friend! Here is the materials list, along with information about that miserable thief.
Perhaps this one will sing, and reveal their motives, as well as where they've taken my tools!
I've almost exhausted my stockpile. But I have confidence you'll handle matters swiftly, and return with good news and packs of supplies!
Bentornato! You come with many gifts! And you faced that scoundrel and recovered my compass! Sei magnifico!
Ah, my mamma gave me this compass when I embarked on my voyage... I wish I could see her again…
"I also found this note."
Those idioti are after money? That's all? Money was never the goal! I'm doing this for everyone on Aeternum! Not just the wealthy!
In any case, would you help me with the last stages of the building?
Magnifico! Now, travelers have a haven from the dangers and horrors of this island. This is my dream: a home for all who need it.
"A very noble dream."
Which we must share! My part is to build more homes as soon as I restock. As for you, my thanks are insufficient. Take this, please. It's the least I can do.
If I may, I will seek you out again if I need assistance.

Complete the construction of Traveler's Rest
Mandatory Improvements
Collect the materials for Giacomo's recipe, then craft the Ancient Protection Stones at an Arcane Repository
"I'm glad to hear it."
Listen carefully - I've rediscovered how the Ancients protected some of their sites. Ah! Ah!
This secret could better safeguard the Traveler's Rest! It could change the future of Aeternum!
"That actually is amazing."
Certo! You see, the Ancients created protection stones for their sites. Unfortunately, I used the last of mine to surround the first Traveler's Rest.
If I give you this recipe, would you craft more for me?
Because I am cautious, there are a few steps not in that recipe that I'll keep secret… at least for now. But in time, I'll share my knowledge. But not for a profit!
Bentornato! And just in time! This road is well-traveled. I've had my hands full keeping the less friendly sorts away.
Were you able to create the stones as I asked?
"Yes, here they are."
Bravo, amico! If only I'd found you instead of those idioti, this would've been done months ago.
Again, grazie, . You are a blessing to all good souls. Per favore, take this as a small token of thanks.

Closing Cost
Track down Airic Niclisson, the leader of those who betrayed Giacomo
"Their leader is this... Airic?"
Si, Airic Niclisson, the foreman of my treacherous crew. I'm certain he was the mastermind of their scheme.
The trouble is, I've received no word of him, which means the scoundrel is hiding.
"What do you want to do?"
I've put the word out for any information. But this time, I must be involved. I'll travel north and try to find anything there.
You should check with Innkeep Lam in Mourningdale. She'll know of anyone strange in the area.
Just preparing for the road, then I'm on my way. I hope to find Airic myself. But I'm uncertain what to do then.
At least find out what happened to the rest of my tools... beyond that, who knows? Good luck to you, friend!
Welcome to Lam's Retreat. This is the best place to stay when enjoying the Azoth-infused streams here in Mourningdale.
"Giacomo sent me. Any news?"
I wondered if he'd come himself. Glad he was smart and sent someone more capable.
The man he's searching for passed through recently. Said he was looking for Ancient artifacts for some project. He headed northeast.
Friend! Any news? You found him! What did that scoundrel say when faceded with his crimes? E fatta. He got what he deserved.
"I was able to recover this."
My plumbum! I'm surprised that he kept it. This was a gift from my good friend and teacher, Giulio.
Grazie. You have been more than a friend. These trophy pieces may not be much, but they are given with affection!
