Greetings, intrepid adventurer! Have you perchance ambled up from the shore? What tidings do you bring?
The town of Prydwen anxiously awaits news of that colossal storm.
Welcome to Prydwen, founded during the reign of the High King, a legacy honored to this day!
Ah, a report from Watcher Reese? Thank you! Hm. So it was foul Corruption behind the storm? Very well. I will dispatch a Knight straightaway.
In his report, Watcher Reese acknowledges your heroism, in which case, you belong here - Prydwen has a strong tradition of heroes.
Of course, we always welcome guests, and you've arrived at a most fortuitous occasion.
Fortuitous Times
Ser Payne Bennett has requested you to meet the Minister of Monarch's Bluffs in his office.
"What's so fortuitous?"
Why, we have just learned the True Heir to the throne is returning to the region!
This is a day we have been awaiting for centuries, and a sign of new hope even during these troublesome times.
“Where has the heir been?”
I could recount the legends for days, but I must dispatch someone to the shore now.
The Knight-Regent is indisposed, but Minister Lochnir runs day-to-day affairs in Prydwen.
Minister Lochnir has been managing affairs in this town longer than most of us have been here. He's someone you simply must meet. Don't dally, now!
Well now, two new faces to Prydwen in one day - many a year since I've seen that. But these are special times.
After centuries, the True Heir returns, and the royal bloodline will once again sit upon the throne.
"Who is the True Heir? "
Forgive me, I take it for granted all are aware. The heir is Ser Gawain himself, most gallant of the High King's knights.
You will have the honor to see his homecoming, and the return of Prydwen's glory after many dark years.
Talk to Minister Lochnir, of Monarch's Bluffs
Find Minister Lochnir in his office
Introduce yourself to Minister Lochnir
"When does Gawain return?"
Only a matter of days. I am personally attending to preparations even now, as is my duty.
Tradition is everything, wouldn't you say? One such custom I've established is that we offer our guests a complementary room at the inn.
“Thank you. I appreciate that.”
You'll find the inn quite hospitable. I hand-selected the innkeep a few decades ago.
So by all means, check in and have a warm meal by the fire. I must attend to other matters now, but we will speak again.
The hour of the True Heir's return approaches quickly, and I have much to do. You are welcome at the inn.
Well, you got that coin I just gave you so I'd suggest you get to spending it.
Buy yourself a new blade, some new boots, whatever suits your fancy.
That overly chipper knight from the town gate dropped by, says he wants to have a word with you.
That Ser Payne and Minister Lochnir talk this place up like it's got a grand history and a bright future, but I'm not buying it.
Word in the tavern is that Prydwen's overrun with people fleeing from trouble at the outlying farms.
I didn't trust all the shite coming out of that Watcher's mouth, but maybe there was some truth to it.
Ask Ser Payne about these soulless Lost outside town. Maybe get a more honest idea of what's happening here.
One of the fellas in the tavern told me Ser Payne's two hundred years old! It's going to take me a while to get used to this place.
Come, you will find shelter in Prydwen, traveler.
Care for the townspeople as you would your family, and you will always be welcome here.
Come in, and be welcome. I will never forget the way this island tested me when I first arrived.
I strive to ensure we are patient with newcomers, and in these times, our customs are even more difficult to observe.
“I've felt very welcome here.”
That is good to hear. I believe Ser Payne represents us well, and the spirit of everything Prydwen stands for.
However, with all the anticipation surrounding Ser Gawain's return, we risk letting our optimism turn into denial.
For weeks now, we've heard horror stories from people fleeing the farms, grieving the loved ones that turned on them.
Behind their words, I sense a suppressed longing to surrender their own souls to despair.
"What have you done for them?"
We offer shelter, comfort, and we dispatched knights to secure the roads, but many never returned.
Minister Lochnir counsels patience. He believes the royal bloodline will solve all problems. But I feel I must act.
"What can I do to help?"
The mines are the backbone of Prydwen, where many townspeople earn their livelihoods. I've had no reports in days.
I simply ask you visit and confirm with Foreman Allya that all is well. Then report back to me, please.
Did you meet with the Minister? He will certainly get you started in your new life here in Prydwen!
Excellent to see you again! Perhaps Miss O'Malley can be trusted, after all.
As to you, however, the Watcher's report guarantees it. In fact, the Knight-Regent would like to discuss a rather… delicate situation, if you're willing.
"Is this about 'the Lost'?"
Oh? So you have heard the unfortunate news from outlying areas…
I'm sorry to hear that. We try not to worry newcomers with such things, but we've even had some knights who've failed to report in.
"Sounds pretty serious."
Yes, well… I hope… I mean, I have the utmost confidence this will be cleared up before the heir arrives.
I think the Knight-Regent simply wants to take precautions. Please, speak with her when you can.
Here, we honor the traditions from the reign of the High King. I take personal interest in ensuring that.
Across the centuries, I've watched the light fade from Monarch's Bluffs in the absence of a true ruler.
Of course, the Knight-Regent has done all she can, with my wise counsel. And now, our patience will soon be rewarded.
I do hope you appreciate your good fortune. The future is very bright.
And for that I'm mighty grateful, sure enough! But I believe I may have found the source of this terrible curse. You've got to see for yourself!
When the True Heir assumes the throne, we will restore Prydwen's former glory.
This whole thing started when we found a damn tablet deep in the mine.
Someone had tried to make it look like it was just unearthed, but I know the look of freshly cut stone, and it wasn't fresh.
“Someone planted the tablet?”
I'm sure of it! The damn thing was making some unearthly sound. Not a one of us would touch it.
The next day, we had Lost pirates jumping down from the rocks, and then everyone started falling Lost.
"You believe the tablet is cursed?"
Well I'm no sorcerer, but that tablet's what started all this, no doubt about it.
We need to destroy the damn thing… and maybe gather any fragments and take them back to Prydwen. There's smart people there.
"Alright. And then you'll leave?"
Sure enough! I'm not looking to linger here with pirates and Withered swarming all over.
Break that tablet and who knows? Maybe all those Lost will disperse. Either way, I'll go. You have my word.
God's blood! I didn't think you could actually pull it off, but you did! Though it seems my hope of the Lost leaving the mine won't be happening anytime soon.
A promise is a promise. You held up your end of the bargain, so it's my turn.
I'll go, but I swear one thing - I'll be coming back to reclaim this place as soon as we get the Lost out.
"Alright. Ready when you are."
You did all the work, so I'll let you have the honor of bringing whatever remains of that tablet back to Prydwen.
There's sages and people of that sort who can make sense of them. Oh. Ask the Knight-Regent, she'll know.
"Where will you go?"
The Foreman's a stubborn one, and I'll wager she's still waiting at the mine's entrance.
I'll go tell her there's none left to save, and then I'll see you in town. I'll even buy you a round at Geertie's!
A deal's a deal. You said you'd take whatever's left of that tablet back to Prydwen. So get to it, then.
I'm glad to see you've returned safely. Not long after you departed, I finally heard the news.
Tell me though, is it as bad as they say? Surely some of the miners made it out?
But tell Geertie to keep a warm pot of soup going. I'll get out at some point!
"They dug up an ancient tablet."
A mysterious tablet, in the mines? Hm... These fragments appear to be Ancient in origin. I'm no expert, but I will consult the sage, Younge Geiser.
In the meantime, I need to know how the mine fell without my knowledge.
"The Foreman sent several missives."
Really? She said that? There's only one conceivable explanation for me not receiving the missives.
Minister Lochnir must have been keeping such reports from reaching my desk.
"Why would he do that?"
That's a very good question. Perhaps it slipped his mind with all the preparations for Ser Gawain? I should allow him to clarify this point.
Would you mind seeking him out? Then perhaps we'll all talk.
I've sent missive after missive to the Minister, and I think I said: "send every knight available!" Doesn't look like that's what's happening.
I can't think of any reasonable explanation why Lochnir would keep the Foreman's missives from me. I am anxious to hear what he has to say.
Oh yes, I am well aware. I received those missives myself.
Believe it or not, while you were battling on the beach, we apprehended an enemy spy!
We all saw Miss O'Malley in Prydwen, and now we caught her skulking out of the pirates' lair.
Bravo, my bold friend! I feared the pirates would overwhelm you, but it seems you are nigh unstoppable.
With their supplies cut off and boats adrift, their ability to wage war will be severely diminished.
Selling goods at market may be enough for some folks, but it’s too slow for me.
I loosened lips at the tavern until I heard about these pirates. Then I came for the loot. Tell this suspicious sod, that's the only reason I'm here.
"She's not a spy. She with us."
She insisted she was here scouting the place for her own ends.
I find that extremely hard to believe. Look at her, looking all suspicious. But I suppose if you're willing to vouch for her, we should at least hear what she has to say.
I've watched these rotters, I know what's driving them, making them go mad.
If this sod didn't have his head up his arse, I could've already told you everything you need to know.
"Grace, what did you see?"
I'll tell ya, but if you go in, I'm expecting some loot.
There's some kind of altar in there, glowing like a beacon. The bastards are drawn to it like flies to a carcass. I'd wager they'll wander off if you smash the damn thing.
Ser "Pain-in-my-Arse" here tells me the Knight-Regent might be hiring new scouts as well, so I'll be heading back to Prydwen. See you there!
It is most excellent to see you return in good health. You are one of the few I can trust in these strange times.
Your… enterprising friend Grace left just moments ago. She said some foul altar was rallying the pirates?
"Yes, but we destroyed it."
I think it is natural to assume this strange altar was somehow related to the tablet you found at Hiraeth Peak.
My sage, Younge Geiser, has been studying the fragments you brought back. He believes they are Ancient in origin.
You have been here a short time, but perhaps you have seen the ruins yourself.
Though humans have inhabited this island for thousands of years, there was a mysterious Ancient Civilization here even before we arrived.
Younge understands the Ancient language better than scholars ten times his age. I'd take his advice and inspect Khalladan and Antares.
"Is that where the Lost came from?"
Many have sought answers to such questions, but few can claim to have reliable knowledge.
One thing I do know however, is that the Lost usually stay away from the ruins of the Ancients.
"But this magic does affect them."
It certainly appears that way, though Sage Geiser insists this tablet was not buried at the mine, but rather planted there.
You should converse with the sage yourself. This new information may yield new insights.
"I'll go right away."
Please exercise discretion in speaking of these matters around town.
The people are excited about the Heir's return; I would not dampen their spirits.
Ah… hello! Wish I had more time to talk. But I’ve got new scrolls to study. Must get to it.
Yours is a face I've not seen before... Aha! You're the newcomer who recovered these fragments from the mine!
I am very excited to speak with you! This material is definitely Ancient! Was there more in the pirate den to the north?
"There was an altar."
An altar? Related to this tablet, then? Fascinating! It couldn't have been there for long.
There's only one possibility - all of this came from the Ancient ruins of Khalladan and Antares in the eastern wood.
"We should investigate the ruins."
Yes!! Only, Minister Lochnir forbade me from going there. It's very dangerous, of course.
But you! Yes, you can go! Start with Khalladan, look for anything recently disturbed. Oh, and don't tell Lochnir!
I can't imagine how the tablet and the altar were affecting the Lost. But if there are answers, they'll come from those ruins!
There you are! I started to venture into those ruins after you, but I lost my nerve when I caught sight of those Guardians.
I hope you found something in there to make it worth your while.
"Are you looking for loot again?"
Ha! I'd wager it'll be the first and last time you hear Grace O'Malley say this, but just now, I'm on official business.
The Knight-Regent sent me to track you down. She says we need your help figuring out what's going on.
"He's planning something bad."
I'd say there's no doubt about that! I tailed the bastard and his entourage. They marched straight into a crowd of the Lost.
The Knight-Regent says Lochnir's gone mad. She wants you to come help as soon as you're done here.
"I need to search the ruins first."
Then I suppose I'll be waiting for you. The Knight-Regent told me not to return without you.
Get on with whatever you're doing, and if you find any treasure in the ruins, don't forget your dear friend Grace.
Whatever that Minister Lochnir's up to, it's well scary. I'd say let's finish our work here as quick as we can and get going.

The legends are true! I just needed to replicate that stone tablet. 

I had to bind and kill the poor young squire nearly a dozen times before he finally surrendered his soul, but after he fell... he was easy to control. He will walk wherever this tablet is placed. 

And this sphere, a tiny thing with tremendous power! Having this power in the palm of my hand will be an immense boon to my goal. I will make myself a staff from it, a fitting accessory for the right hand of the True King.
Hey! Something just occurred to me… about this island and how we might get off it.
Give me a little space here! I need a minute to think!
Just after you left Prydwen, that wide-eyed Minister Lochnir started acting strange, shouting around town that the True Heir's arrival was upon us.
He led some knights and even some townsfolk down south to "welcome the new king!"
Well, you were gone long enough, I was starting to worry you'd fallen to those Guardians.
Did you find anything else in there relating to the Minister's plans?
"Yes, he's controlling the Lost."
Well, I'll be damned if that doesn't explain a lot of the queer happenings around here.
I suppose that's how he's able to walk freely among the those blue-eyed rotters as well.
With that revelation, I'd say it's all the more urgent that you catch up with the Knight-Regent.
She wants you to meet her at the last of the farms that hasn't fallen to the Lost. It's not too far from here.
"She left the town unprotected?"
She left Ser Payne in charge of Prydwen's defenses. She wanted to see to these troubles personally.
I suspect the Knight-Regent's looking to draw steel against Lochnir herself. You best get going.
"Aren't you coming too?"
The Knight-Regent asked me to circle down to the pirate dens further south, see what's happening there.
I'll catch up with you at the farm soon enough.
Keep your eyes on the horizon, my friend, and always stay upwind of your enemies.
I cannot express how reassuring it is to have your presence down here.
As much respect as I've always had for Minister Lochnir, it is painfully clear that he's suddenly gone quite mad.
"He's been scheming for a while."
Is that what you discovered in the ruins? Was Lochnir behind the strange tablet at the mine? The pirates, too?
I am having trouble understanding what his ultimate goal is, or if he even has one.
"Is this related to the True Heir?"
I question everything the Minister said now, but apparently the Knights at Teyrnon Keep met Ser Gawain.
Percilla here was a knight there herself, until recently. I believe she's hiding something. You should speak to her.
"What are your plans for Lochnir?"
I fear what Lochnir's ultimate intentions could be. I probably should return to Prydwen to bolster the town's defenses.
Have you encountered Minister Lochnir yet? My sources suspect he may have turned into one of the Lost himself.
The King is… [sigh]
Well met, stranger. The Knight-Regent said you have been her only reliable counsel in recent days.
For your service to her, and to Prydwen, I salute you. I was a knight myself, not long ago.
"And now you're farming?"
Um… yes. When the farms in these parts started falling to the Lost, the town's supplies were threatened.
I... volunteered to take over this farm to ensure Prydwen did not go hungry. It was… a difficult decision.
I will defend this farm with everything I have. It shall not fall to the Lost. We will support Prydwen until the bitter end.
It was not long after I left Teyrnon Keep that my fellow knights there… fell to becoming Lost as well.
If I overheard correctly, you found proof that Lochnir planned all of this?
"Yes, he can control the Lost."
That… explains much. I know the Minister had planned to claim the Circlet of Swords, the royal crown of Monarch's Bluffs, from Teyrnon Keep.
If he can control the Lost Knights there, I suppose that's how he'll do it.
"We should try to stop him."
I suspect it’s already too late, and my fellow knights still defend the Keep as firmly as ever.
I’d advise against going - there's nothing there but death and grief. But… perhaps you may discover more of Lochnir's plan.
"You should join me."
No, I will not raise my blade against my fellow knights, even in the state they're in.
I will give you this seal, however. You'll also need the seals of the other knights to access the sacred chamber inside the Keep.
Again, I would urge you to reconsider this course of action.
My fellow knights are formidable combatants. Getting their seals will be difficult.
You ventured into Teyrnon Keep and returned with your soul intact? You are indeed as worthy as the Knight-Regent claimed.
I trust you discovered that Lochnir had already taken the crown? I suspected as much.
"He got in without your seal?"
He… oh, God's blood! I cannot bear the burden of this dark secret any more!
I was there, and I witnessed when Lochnir brought Ser Gawain for us to swear loyalty!
The Minister told us we would be honored to be the first to kneel before the new king.
But when he ushered Ser Gawain into the Keep, we realized… the True Heir was Lost himself! We were aghast, speechless.
"What happened?"
The Minister reminded us of our sworn duty to the royal bloodline. He told us the sacrifice of becoming Lost was noble and right.
Then he lined us up, and killed us one-by one. I… faltered. I couldn't do it, so I... fled.
"It wasn't noble, it was madness."
I was ashamed, unwilling to join them in soullessness, but also unwilling to betray my comrades and the bloodline.
I regret it now… I should've come to the Knight-Regent sooner. Perhaps I could've prevented all this…
"It's not too late. Join me."
I… alright, it is my duty. The Knight-Regent has returned to Prydwen, but we can try to stop Lochnir down here.
A scout was sent southward, you should seek them out. Once I dig up my armor, I will join you. And friend… thank you.
I believe the Knight-Regent said this new scout was a recent arrival, like yourself. I think her name was Grace.
I was so ashamed of abandoning my duties that I buried my armor.
I shall dig it up and join you. I hope this will restore some measure of my honor…
Thank goodness I found someone I can report to! And better it's not the Knight-Regent.
Remember all those Lost pirates swarming around that den to the north? That was a small affair compared to this place.
"What did you learn?"
Good old Minister Lochnir was here sure enough. There's another one of those glowing altars.
But this time, I don't think he's meaning to draw the pirates in, but rather send them forth.
The rotten bastards are loading up their ships with explosives as we speak.
I'd wager they're sailing for Prydwen as soon as he gives word. They'll blast the town from here to Connacht!
n/a
So she spoke the truth after all? That Grace character told me you'd gone in there on your own, but I had to see it to believe it.
I heard the ruckus and saw the smoke. Am I to assume that means your mission was a success?
"They won't be attacking Prydwen."
Well, there's cause for celebration! It's even tempting to take the good news to Prydwen right away.
But I believe there's an opportunity to strike a critical blow against the enemy, here and now.
Ser Gawain and his court of Lost Knights are not far. They're fortified in his ancestral home across the water, Corbenic Castle.
I suspect that's where Lochnir has led his unfortunate followers, as well.
"We should go then."
Yes, though we need a plan. They have the Circlet of Swords and an army of Lost has already fallen under Ser Gawain's influence.
Defeating a knight of legend will be hard enough, but won't he just return to command them again?
"We'll destroy Lochnir's staff."
Is that how that craven madman controls the Lost? Yes, it makes sense now.
I thought perhaps it was Gawain's royal blood, but now I see, this whole thing is a contrivance of Lochnir's.
"Let's go and put an end to it."
Yes, let's do just that. I will mark the spot on your map where we can set up a defensive position and plan our attack.
I will meet you there, and if the hand of justice is with us, we will prevail.
I don’t know what defenses this tower possesses, but it is clearly well-fortified, and Lochnir has undoubtedly taken precautions.
I would expect heavy resistance.
"We can handle it."
Your courage is unquestionable, and I've witnessed your prowess in battle. You're a force to be reckoned with.
But if I'm being honest, I'd prefer not to take up arms against my former comrades nor the heir of Artorius.
"I understand. You can stay here."
Thank you. I will defend this position to ensure none come to the castle's defense and that Lochnir does not escape.
Defeat those villains, destroy that damn staff, and reclaim the crown. I look forward to your triumphant return!
Do what must be done. You're the only one who can stop them!
I think I've been holding my breath since you departed, or at least it feels that way.
Tell me, did you defeat Ser Gawain and destroy Lochnir's infernal staff?
"I have the Circlet of Swords."
Praise to whatever gods are at your back! I feel like I'm waking from a long nightmare.
My thrill at learning of the True Heir's return was only matched by the horror of learning what he had become.
After this, perhaps we should consider abandoning this obsession with restoring the royal bloodline.
We can't return the Circlet of Swords to Teyrnon Keep, anyhow. I think we should return it to Prydwen.
"The Knight-Regent should have it."
Yes, though Jae is bound by her duty. She'd make an excellent queen but she can't even imagine such a thing.
I suspect the court training of her youth is to blame. Her humility will be yet another formidable foe.
“We’ll have to convince her.”
Yes. We’ll speak to the people. We’ll tell them the truth about Lochnir and the heir.
The crown deserves to be worn by a noble ruler, a ruler like Jin Jae. I'll see you in Prydwen, comrade.
Now that we have the Circlet of Swords, we need to convince Jin Jae to take the mantle of leadership.Hopefully, she'll accept the crown.
<g id="yonas_saluteFistchest" />The new Queen will need a Knight-Commander. If she'll have me, <g id="yonas_headnodyes" />I will stand at her side, from now... until the end of eternity.
Word of your victory has already breached the walls, and we are extremely grateful.
I welcome you back to Prydwen as a hero. I can never repay the debt this town owes to you.
"You could accept the crown."
I… am not sure. I do not have royal blood… but I suppose we've learned that the bloodline is now cursed.
Strangely enough, your friend Grace suggested the same thing just before she left.
"Where did Grace go?"
We were in the tavern after word of your success, and someone mentioned a ship builder in Oxboro.
She was so eager to meet this person, she left right away. She did ask me to tell you, of course.
I would understand if you wished to follow and seek adventure to the north yourself.
Otherwise, I do have Ser Payne and Ser Percilla, but I could always use more knights. Especially if I am to become queen.
"So you will accept the crown?"
Yes, after careful consideration, I realize it is the honorable thing. It is the ultimate requirement of my sworn duty.
Will you stay then and serve Prydwen at my side? Or do voices call you elsewhere?
"I hear a voice. It's Corruption."
You hear the voice of Corruption? There are legends of its insidious torment. You must be bearing such a burden!
In the days of Artorius, they say it was the voice of Myrddin that called knights to darkness. It drove them mad.
"Is there any way to fight it?"
I know of no cure, but there's an old man who comes to Prydwen now and then. He warns about Corruption.
Some say he's deranged, but I see wisdom in his eyes. He fishes the east river. You should seek him out.
If anyone can help you, it would be that old man. He's often fishing on the river to the east. Look for him there.
Now that I hear about this Corrupted voice in your head, the Watcher's Report is even more disturbing.
You should check out the Trading Post yourself and if you need to stash anything, there's a Storage Shed too. Go on, I'll be here.
I fear Gawain and Lochnir were a prelude to an even greater threat that now approaches.
